longTitle.name: longTitle
longTitle.content: An Ordinance to provide for the safety of lifts and escalators, including the registration of contractors, engineers and workers for the purposes of carrying out lift works and escalator works; and to provide for consequential, incidental and related matters.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Short title and commencement

subsection.content: This Ordinance may be cited as the Lifts and Escalators Ordinance.
This Ordinance comes into operation on a day to be appointed by the Secretary for Development by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: b

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of qualified person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a registered lift worker is qualified to carry out any particular lift works if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the registration of the worker is for all kinds of lift works; or

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of responsible person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a person is not to be regarded as a person who has the management or control of a lift only because the person does one or more of the following acts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: uses the lift;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: operates the lift;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: carries out any lift works in relation to the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person is not to be regarded as a person who has the management or control of an escalator only because the person does one or more of the following acts—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: uses the escalator;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: operates the escalator;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: carries out any escalator works in relation to the escalator.

subsection.content: For the purposes of sections 17, 18, 36, 48, 49 and 66, a person engages in any lift works or escalator works if the person personally carries out the works, or supervises any other person to carry out the works.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, regard must be had to the relevant code of practice in determining—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether there is sufficient workforce to carry out any lift works or escalator works;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether there are adequate equipment and tools for carrying out any lift works or escalator works;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: whether a lift or escalator or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift or escalator is of good design and construction;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: whether a lift or escalator or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift or escalator is thoroughly examined, or whether a thorough examination has been carried out in respect of a lift or escalator or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: whether a lift or escalator or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift or escalator is kept in a proper state of repair;

paragraph.name: g
h
paragraph.content: whether any lift works or escalator works are carried out properly and safely; or

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: whether a person is under the direct or proper supervision of a qualified person.

subsection.content: For the purposes of this Ordinance, if an event or incident occurs or takes place on 29 February in a leap year, or any act or work is done or completed on 29 February in a leap year, a reference to an anniversary of that date in a year that is not a leap year is a reference to an anniversary of 28 February in that year.
For the purposes of this Ordinance, if a document or registration is expressed to expire or end on a particular date, the document or registration continues to have effect until the end of that day.
A note located in the text of this Ordinance is provided for information only and has no legislative effect.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of Ordinance to lifts and escalators

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), this Ordinance applies to every lift and every escalator.

subsection.leadIn: This Ordinance does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an amusement device, including an amusement ride as defined by section 2(1) of the Amusement Rides (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 449);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a belt, bucket, scoop or roller conveyor or any similar machine;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a hoist, including a skip hoist, used mainly for charging furnaces or similar appliances;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a hoist used solely for lifting or feeding material directly into a machine or used solely for both of those purposes;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: a lift the height of travel of which does not exceed 3.5 m and that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: does not pass through any floor; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is used solely for the carriage, stacking, loading or unloading of any goods or materials or any 2 or more of those purposes;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: a lift the height of travel of which does not exceed 3.5 m and that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: does not pass through any floor; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is used solely for the raising of motor vehicles;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a lift or escalator installed in any ship;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a lift installed in any aircraft;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.leadIn: a lift provided in connection with a building under construction and solely—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: for the use of persons employed in the construction of the building;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for carrying materials used in connection with the construction of the building; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: for the use of persons referred to in subparagraph (i) and carrying materials referred to in subparagraph (ii);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a ramp that is connected to a wharf or pier;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a service lift used in an industrial undertaking; and

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a stage or orchestra lift.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Ordinance applies to Government etc.

subsection.content: This Ordinance applies to the Government.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), the Government—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not liable to be prosecuted for an offence under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is not required to pay any prescribed fee.

subsection.content: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that there has been or is a contravention by the Government of a provision of this Ordinance (including a contravention of an order of the Director under this Ordinance), the Director must report the matter to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: The report must contain the advice of the Director on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the contravention has been terminated; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the contravention has been terminated, whether it has been terminated to the Director’s satisfaction.

subsection.content: On receiving the report from the Director, the Secretary must enquire into the matter to which the report relates.

If the enquiry shows that there has been a contravention referred to in subsection (3) and the contravention is likely to be repeated, the Secretary must take the best practicable steps to avoid the recurrence of a like contravention.
If the enquiry shows that there is a contravention referred to in subsection (3) and the contravention is continuing, the Secretary must take the best practicable steps to stop the contravention.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Jointly owned etc. lift or escalator
section.content: If this Ordinance imposes a requirement on the responsible person for a lift or escalator, and there are 2 or more responsible persons for the lift or escalator, compliance with the requirement by one of those responsible persons is to be regarded as compliance with the requirement by every other responsible person for the lift or escalator.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Only qualified persons or specified persons to personally carry out lift works, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not personally carry out any lift works unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a qualified person or specified person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is under the direct supervision of a qualified person at the place at which the works are carried out.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

A person who knowingly causes or permits any other person to carry out any lift works in contravention of subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Prohibition against using or operating lifts in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: If any of the following lift works have begun in respect of a lift, a person must not use or operate the lift before the works are completed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lift works concerning the installation of the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lift works concerning any major alteration of the lift;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: lift works concerning the demolition of the lift;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: lift works that are likely to affect the safe operation of the lift.

subsection.content: A person must not use or operate a lift if there is no use permit in force in respect of the lift.
A person must not use or operate a lift after the completion of any major alteration of the lift unless a resumption permit has been issued in relation to the alteration.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knowingly contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly causes or permits any other person to use or operate a lift in contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a responsible person for the lift.
This section does not apply to the use or operation of a lift in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply if the use or operation of the lift is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of or in connection with the carrying out of any lift works described in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Part.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Prohibition against carriage of persons in lifts specified in Schedule 4

subsection.content: A person must not travel in a lift specified in Schedule 4.
A person must not cause or permit a lift specified in Schedule 4 to be used for carrying any person.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
A person who knowingly causes or permits a lift to be used in contravention of subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
This section does not apply to a responsible person for the lift.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Prohibition against overloading lifts specified in Schedule 4

subsection.content: A person must not cause or permit a lift specified in Schedule 4 to be used for carrying any load that exceeds the rated load of the lift.
A person who knowingly contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
This section does not apply to a responsible person for the lift.

This section does not apply if the use of the lift is for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Part.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Duties of Responsible Persons and Registered Persons

section.name: s12
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons to ensure that lifts are in proper state of repair and in safe working order

subsection.content: The responsible person for a lift must ensure that the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery are kept in a proper state of repair and in safe working order.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons in respect of use and operation of lifts

subsection.leadIn: If any of the following lift works have begun in respect of a lift, the responsible person for the lift must ensure that the lift is not used or operated before the works are completed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lift works concerning the installation of the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lift works concerning any major alteration of the lift;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: lift works concerning the demolition of the lift;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: lift works that are likely to affect the safe operation of the lift.

subsection.content: The responsible person for a lift must ensure that the lift is not used or operated if there is no use permit in force in respect of the lift.
The responsible person for a lift must ensure that the lift is not used or operated after any major alteration of the lift unless a resumption permit has been issued in relation to the alteration.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lift was used or operated without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the use or operation of the lift.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to the use or operation of a lift in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply if the use or operation of the lift is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of or in connection with the carrying out of any lift works described in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Part.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Additional duties of responsible persons regarding lifts specified in Schedule 4

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person for a lift specified in Schedule 4 must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lift is not used for carrying any person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the lift is not used for carrying any load that exceeds the rated load of the lift.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (2) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lift was used without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the use.

subsection.content: Subsection (1)(b) does not apply if the use of the lift is for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Part.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons to ensure that registered lift contractors undertake maintenance works and certain other lift works

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person for a lift must ensure that any of the following lift works must not be carried out unless the works are undertaken by a registered lift contractor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lift works concerning the installation of the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: lift works concerning any major alteration of the lift;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: lift works concerning the demolition of the lift;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: lift works that are likely to affect the safe operation of the lift.

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person for a lift must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a registered lift contractor to undertake the maintenance works of a lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that periodic maintenance works are carried out in respect of the lift at intervals not exceeding the period specified in or determined under Part 1 of Schedule 5.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Duties of registered lift contractors to carry out lift works properly and safely, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift contractor who undertakes any lift works must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works are carried out properly and safely;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property while the works are being carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is sufficient workforce to carry out the works;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: there are adequate equipment and tools for carrying out the works;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the works are works concerning the installation of a lift, the works are not to be carried out unless the lift and all the safety components for the lift are respectively of a type in respect of which the contractor has obtained approval from the Director;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the works are works other than those specified in paragraph (e) and any safety component is required for the works, the works are not to be carried out unless the safety component is of a type in respect of which the contractor has obtained approval from the Director; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if the works are works concerning the demolition of a lift, measures are in so far as reasonably practicable taken to minimize the impact the works may have on the structural integrity of the building in which the lift is installed, or of which the lift is or forms a part.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Duties of registered lift engineers to carry out lift works properly and safely, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift engineer who engages in any lift works must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works are carried out properly and safely;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property while the works are being carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the works are works concerning the installation of a lift, the works are not to be carried out unless the lift and all the safety components for the lift are respectively of a type in respect of which the registered lift contractor who undertakes the works has obtained approval from the Director; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the works are works other than those specified in paragraph (c) and any safety component is required for the works, the works are not to be carried out unless the safety component is of a type in respect of which the registered lift contractor who undertakes the works has obtained approval from the Director.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Duties of registered lift workers to carry out lift works properly and safely, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift worker who engages in any lift works must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works are carried out properly and safely; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property while the works are being carried out.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: For the purposes of this Division, a lift or any part of a lift, or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift, is examined by a registered lift engineer only if the lift or part, or the associated equipment or machinery, is personally examined by the engineer or any other person who is under the direct and proper supervision of the engineer at the place at which the examination takes place.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Examination of lifts before putting into use and operation

subsection.leadIn: Before a lift is put into use and operation, the responsible person for the lift must cause a registered lift engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to examine the lift with load and in accordance with section 24(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to thoroughly examine all the associated equipment or machinery of the lift.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
This section does not apply to a lift that has been installed and put into use and operation before the date on which section 157 comes into operation.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Examination of lifts after major alterations

subsection.leadIn: If any major alteration has been made in respect of a lift, before the normal use and operation of the lift is resumed, the responsible person for the lift must cause a registered lift engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to thoroughly examine the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to examine the affected part of the lift in accordance with section 25(1).

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Periodic examination of lifts

subsection.content: The responsible person for a lift must cause the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery to be thoroughly examined by a registered lift engineer at intervals not exceeding the period specified in or determined under Part 2 of Schedule 5.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s23
section.heading: Examination of lifts with load

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person for a lift must cause a registered lift engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to examine the lift with load and in accordance with section 24(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to thoroughly examine all its associated equipment or machinery,

subsection.continued: at intervals not exceeding the period specified in or determined under Part 3 of Schedule 5.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Issue of safety certificates by registered lift engineers

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a registered lift engineer who undertakes to examine a lift must ensure that the lift is thoroughly examined by the engineer.

subsection.leadIn: A registered lift engineer who undertakes to examine a lift with load must ensure that the lift—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is thoroughly examined by the engineer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is examined by the engineer in accordance with Schedule 6.

subsection.content: A registered lift engineer who undertakes to examine any associated equipment or machinery of a lift must ensure that the associated equipment or machinery is thoroughly examined by the engineer.

If on examination under this section, the registered lift engineer is of the opinion that the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery are of good design and construction and in safe working condition, the engineer may issue to the responsible person specified in subsection (9) a certificate in respect of the lift certifying that the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery are in safe working order.
The certificate referred to in subsection (4) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: If on examination under this section the registered lift engineer is of the opinion that the lift or any of its associated equipment or machinery is not of good design and construction or is not in safe working condition, the engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not issue a certificate under subsection (4); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must within 24 hours after the examination is completed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: notify in writing the responsible person specified in subsection (10) of the reasons for not issuing the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: report to the Director the result of the examination and the opinion of the engineer.

subsection.content: The report under subsection (6)(b)(ii) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (6) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the lift concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (6)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the lift concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Issue of safety certificates by registered lift engineers after major alterations

subsection.content: A registered lift engineer who undertakes to examine any affected part of a lift must ensure that the lift and its associated equipment or machinery are thoroughly examined by the engineer, in so far as is necessary to determine whether the affected part is in safe working order.

If on examination under subsection (1), the registered lift engineer is of the opinion that the affected part is of good design and construction and in safe working condition, the engineer may issue to the responsible person specified in subsection (7) a certificate in respect of the lift certifying that the affected part is in safe working order.
The certificate referred to in subsection (2) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: If on examination under subsection (1), the registered lift engineer is of the opinion that the affected part is not in safe working order, the engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not issue a certificate under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must within 24 hours after the examination is completed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: notify in writing the responsible person specified in subsection (8) of the reasons for not issuing the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: report to the Director the result of the examination and the opinion of the engineer.

subsection.content: The report under subsection (4)(b)(ii) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the lift concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the lift concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Issue etc. of use permits

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 150, the Director may on application issue in respect of a lift—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a permit, in the specified form, permitting the lift to be put into use and operation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a permit, in the specified form, permitting the lift to continue to be used and operated.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to issue a permit under subsection (1) for a lift if there is a contravention of section 23 in relation to the lift.
The Director may refuse to issue a permit under subsection (1) if there is a contravention of section 143 in relation to the lift.
The Director must not issue a permit under subsection (1) unless the Director is satisfied that the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery are in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to refuse an application or refuse to issue a permit under this section, the Director must as soon as reasonably practicable after making the decision notify in writing the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the work that in the opinion of the Director is necessary to put the lift or any of its associated equipment or machinery in safe working order.

subsection.content: This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under sections 41 and 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s27
section.heading: Validity period of use permits

subsection.leadIn: A permit issued under section 26(1)(a) relating to an examination of a lift—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on the 1st anniversary of the date of completion of the examination.

subsection.leadIn: A permit issued under section 26(1)(b) relating to an examination of a lift that was completed within the period of 2 months ending on the date of expiry of the preceding use permit of the lift—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on the 1st anniversary of the date of expiry of the preceding use permit.

subsection.leadIn: Any other permit issued under section 26(1)(b) relating to an examination of a lift—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on the 1st anniversary of the date of completion of the examination.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Issue etc. of resumption permits

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, the Director may on application issue in respect of a lift a permit, in the specified form, permitting the use and operation of the lift to be resumed after a major alteration is made in respect of the lift.
The Director may refuse to issue a permit under subsection (1) if there is a contravention of section 143 in relation to the lift.
The Director must not issue a permit under subsection (1) unless the Director is satisfied that the affected part of the lift is in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to refuse an application or refuse to issue a permit under this section, the Director must as soon as reasonably practicable after making the decision notify in writing the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the work that in the opinion of the Director is necessary to put the affected part of the lift in safe working order.

subsection.content: This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under sections 41 and 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s29
section.heading: Issue of duplicates of use permits and resumption permits

subsection.content: If a permit issued under section 26 or 28 is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged, subject to section 150, the Director may on application issue a duplicate permit to replace the original permit.
A duplicate permit issued under subsection (1) has the same effect as the original permit and is to be treated as having been issued under the section under which the original permit was issued.
On the issue of a duplicate permit, the original permit ceases to be valid.
When making an application for a duplicate permit, the applicant must return the original permit to the Director if it is available to the applicant.
The Director may refuse an application under this section if the applicant contravenes subsection (4).

section.name: s30
section.heading: Prohibition orders

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order served on the responsible person for a lift prohibit the lift from being used or operated, or continuing to be used or operated, if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the lift is one specified in Schedule 4—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the lift is used, or is likely to be used, for carrying any person; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the lift is used, or is likely to be used, for carrying any load that exceeds the rated load of the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the lift has been used or operated, or is or is likely to be used or operated, in contravention of section 9;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the responsible person has contravened section 15(2)(b), 22(1) or 23(1);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the lift if used or operated, or continued to be used or operated, will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the lift, or any of its associated equipment or machinery, is not in safe working order; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: it is otherwise desirable to do so in the interest of safety.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the order is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: A person who uses or operates a lift in contravention of an order made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

A person who causes or permits any other person to use or operate a lift in contravention of an order made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the use or operation was prohibited under an order made under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the use or operation was prohibited under an order made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contravention occurred without the person’s consent or connivance and that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the use or operation of the lift.

subsection.content: Subsections (3) and (4) do not apply to the use or operation of a lift in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

Subsections (3) and (4) do not apply if the use or operation of the lift is for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Ordinance.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Director’s power to disconnect supply of electricity

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that a lift is being used or operated, or is likely to be used or operated, in contravention of an order made under section 30, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disconnect or, if any lift works of the lift are undertaken by a registered lift contractor, by order served on the contractor direct the contractor to disconnect, the supply of electricity to the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out, or by order served on the contractor mentioned in paragraph (a) direct the contractor to carry out, any work that is necessary to prevent, as far as possible, any person from reconnecting the supply of electricity to the lift before written permission has been obtained from the Director to reconnect the supply.

subsection.content: If the registered lift contractor on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the contractor commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: If, without the Director’s written permission, the supply of electricity to a lift is reconnected by any person after it has been disconnected under subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsible person for the lift,

subsection.continued: each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (3) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person charged is the person who reconnected the supply of electricity to the lift, the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the supply of electricity to the lift was disconnected under subsection (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person charged is not the person who reconnected the supply of electricity to the lift but is the responsible person for the lift—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the offence was committed without the responsible person’s consent or connivance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the responsible person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s32
section.heading: Cessation orders in respect of lift works

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order served on the related person of a lift direct the person to cease any lift works that are being carried out in relation to the lift, if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lift works are being carried out in contravention of section 8;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the lift works are being carried out in a manner that will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is otherwise desirable to do so in the interest of safety.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the order is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士), in relation to a lift, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible person for the lift; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered lift contractor (if any) who undertakes the lift works to which the order relates.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Application for cancellation of prohibition orders and cessation orders

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, a person affected by an order under section 30 or 32 may on application request the Director to cancel the order.
If the Director decides to refuse an application under subsection (1), the Director must notify in writing the applicant of the decision and the reasons for the decision.
This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under section 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s34
section.heading: Examination orders

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that it is desirable in the interest of safety to do so, the Director may by order served on the responsible person for a lift direct the person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause the lift or any part of the lift, or any associated equipment or machinery of the lift, to be examined by a registered lift engineer in the manner and within the period specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit within the period specified in the order a report, in the specified form, prepared by the engineer stating whether the engineer is satisfied that the lift or the part of the lift, or the associated equipment or machinery, is in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the reasons for making the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Removal orders

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order served on the responsible person for a lift direct the person to remove the lift or any part of the lift, or any associated equipment or machinery of the lift, if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the lift or the part, or the associated equipment or machinery, if used or operated, or continued to be used or operated, will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is otherwise necessary to do so in the interest of safety.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date before which the lift or the part of the lift, or the associated equipment or machinery, is to be removed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Improvement orders

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance has been contravened or is being contravened in relation to a lift or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a lift or any associated equipment or machinery of a lift is in a state that will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any lift works have been carried out or are being carried out in a manner that will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is otherwise desirable to do so in the interest of safety,

subsection.continued: the Director may by order served on the related person of the lift direct the person to carry out any work specified in the order, in order to rectify or remedy or otherwise put an end to the contravention or to eliminate or reduce any risk of injury to any person or damage to any property.

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (1) may specify the manner in which, and the time within which, any work specified in the order must be carried out or completed.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date before which the work must be completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士), in relation to a lift, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible person for the lift;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered lift contractor (if any) who undertakes the lift works to which the order relates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registered lift engineer (if any) who engages in the lift works to which the order relates.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Director’s power to remove lifts or to carry out other works, etc. in case of non-compliance with section 32 or 35

subsection.content: If an order made under section 32, other than an order made on the ground mentioned in section 32(1)(a), is contravened, the Director may without any notice to the responsible person for the lift carry out any work and provide any service necessary for carrying out the work, to ensure that the order will be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: If an order made under section 35 is contravened, the Director may without any notice to the responsible person for the lift—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove the lift or any part of the lift, or any associated equipment or machinery of the lift, to remedy the contravention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out any work and provide any service necessary for carrying out the work to remedy the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: In any case, if there are reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is necessary to do so to eliminate or reduce any grave or imminent risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is otherwise necessary to do so in the interest of safety,

subsection.continued: the Director may without notice to the responsible person for the lift carry out any work in relation to the lift, and provide any service necessary for carrying out the work.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Subcontracting restricted

subsection.content: Except with the written approval of the Director, a registered lift contractor who undertakes any lift works must not subcontract the works or any part of the works to any other person who is not a registered lift contractor.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
This section does not apply to any works concerning the installation or demolition of a lift.

section.name: s39
section.heading: Display of use permits

subsection.content: The responsible person for a lift, other than a lift specified in Schedule 4, that has a car must ensure that the use permit for the time being in force in respect of the lift is displayed at all times in a conspicuous position in the car of the lift.

The responsible person for any other lift must ensure that the use permit for the time being in force in respect of the lift is displayed at all times in a conspicuous position adjacent to the landing or, if there is more than one landing, the main landing of the lift.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s40
section.heading: Incidents to be reported to Director

subsection.leadIn: If there is an incident relating to a lift, the responsible person for the lift must within 24 hours after the incident comes to the person’s knowledge, notify in writing the Director and the following person of the incident—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered lift contractor who currently undertakes any lift works in respect of the lift; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (a) does not apply, the registered lift contractor who most recently has undertaken any lift works in respect of the lift.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the registered lift contractor who is notified under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a registered lift engineer to investigate the incident and to prepare and complete, within 7 days after the date on which the contractor is notified under subsection (1), a full report of the investigation that complies with any regulation made under section 154; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit to the Director the report within the period specified in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: If for any reason the contractor who is notified under subsection (1) is of the opinion that a full report is unable to be submitted as required under subsection (2), the contractor must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify in writing the Director of the fact within 3 days after the date on which the contractor is notified under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: cause the registered lift engineer referred to in subsection (2)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to prepare and complete, within the period specified in paragraph (a), a preliminary report of the investigation that complies with any regulation made under section 154; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to prepare and complete, within 14 days after the date on which the incident occurs or a longer period that the Director may approve, a full report of the investigation that complies with any regulation made under section 154; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: submit to the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the preliminary report within the period specified in paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the full report within the period within which the report is required to be completed under paragraph (b)(ii).

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s41
section.heading: Investigation of incidents by Director

subsection.content: If an incident relating to a lift has come to the knowledge of the Director, the Director may carry out an investigation in respect of the incident, or cause any other enforcement officer to carry out the investigation.

For the purposes of carrying out an investigation under subsection (1), the Director or any other enforcement officer may request the responsible person for the lift concerned, and the responsible registered lift contractor (if any), to provide without charge any assistance or information that the Director or the officer may reasonably require for carrying out the investigation.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a request under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: responsible registered lift contractor (負責的註冊升降機承辦商) means the registered lift contractor who is required under section 40(2) to cause a registered lift engineer to investigate the incident.

section.name: s42
section.heading: Only qualified persons or specified persons to personally carry out escalator works, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not personally carry out any escalator works unless the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a qualified person or specified person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is under the direct supervision of a qualified person at the place at which the works are carried out.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

A person who knowingly causes or permits any other person to carry out any escalator works in contravention of subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s43
section.heading: Prohibition against using or operating escalators in certain circumstances

subsection.leadIn: If any of the following escalator works have begun in respect of an escalator, a person must not use or operate the escalator before the works are completed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning the installation of the escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning any major alteration of the escalator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning the demolition of the escalator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: escalator works that are likely to affect the safe operation of the escalator.

subsection.content: A person must not use or operate an escalator if there is no use permit in force in respect of the escalator.
A person must not use or operate an escalator after the completion of any major alteration of the escalator unless a resumption permit has been issued in relation to the alteration.

subsection.leadIn: A person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: knowingly contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knowingly causes or permits any other person to use or operate an escalator in contravention of subsection (1), (2) or (3),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to a responsible person for the escalator.
This section does not apply to the use or operation of an escalator in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply if the use or operation of the escalator is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of or in connection with the carrying out of any escalator works described in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Part.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Duties of Responsible Persons and Registered Persons

section.name: s44
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons to ensure that escalators are in proper state of repair and in safe working order

subsection.content: The responsible person for an escalator must ensure that the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery are kept in a proper state of repair and in safe working order.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s45
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons in respect of use and operation of escalators

subsection.leadIn: If any of the following escalator works have begun in respect of an escalator, the responsible person for the escalator must ensure that the escalator is not used or operated before the works are completed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning the installation of the escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning any major alteration of the escalator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning the demolition of the escalator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: escalator works that are likely to affect the safe operation of the escalator.

subsection.content: The responsible person for an escalator must ensure that the escalator is not used or operated if there is no use permit in force in respect of the escalator.

The responsible person for an escalator must ensure that the escalator is not used or operated after any major alteration of the escalator unless a resumption permit has been issued in relation to the alteration.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the escalator was used or operated without the person’s consent or connivance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the use or operation of the escalator.

subsection.content: This section does not apply to the use or operation of an escalator in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not apply if the use or operation of the escalator is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of or in connection with the carrying out of any escalator works described in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Part.

section.name: s46
section.heading: Duties of responsible persons to ensure that registered escalator contractors undertake maintenance works and certain other escalator works

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person for an escalator must ensure that any of the following escalator works must not be carried out unless the works are undertaken by a registered escalator contractor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning the installation of the escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning any major alteration of the escalator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: escalator works concerning the demolition of the escalator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: escalator works that are likely to affect the safe operation of the escalator.

subsection.leadIn: The responsible person for an escalator must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a registered escalator contractor to undertake the maintenance works of an escalator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that periodic maintenance works are carried out in respect of the escalator at intervals not exceeding the period specified in or determined under Part 4 of Schedule 5.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s47
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator contractors to carry out escalator works properly and safely, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator contractor who undertakes any escalator works must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works are carried out properly and safely;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property while the works are being carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: there is sufficient workforce to carry out the works;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: there are adequate equipment and tools for carrying out the works;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the works are works concerning the installation of an escalator, the works are not to be carried out unless the escalator and all the safety components for the escalator are respectively of a type in respect of which the contractor has obtained approval from the Director;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: if the works are works other than those specified in paragraph (e) and any safety component is required for the works, the works are not to be carried out unless the safety component is of a type in respect of which the contractor has obtained approval from the Director; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: if the works are works concerning the demolition of an escalator, measures are in so far as reasonably practicable taken to minimize the impact the works may have on the structural integrity of the building in which the escalator is installed, or of which the escalator is or forms a part.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

section.name: s48
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator engineers to carry out escalator works properly and safely, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator engineer who engages in any escalator works must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works are carried out properly and safely;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property while the works are being carried out;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the works are works concerning the installation of an escalator, the works are not to be carried out unless the escalator and all the safety components for the escalator are respectively of a type in respect of which the registered escalator contractor who undertakes the works has obtained approval from the Director; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the works are works other than those specified in paragraph (c) and any safety component is required for the works, the works are not to be carried out unless the safety component is of a type in respect of which the registered escalator contractor who undertakes the works has obtained approval from the Director.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s49
section.heading: Duties of registered escalator workers to carry out escalator works properly and safely, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A registered escalator worker who engages in any escalator works must ensure that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the works are carried out properly and safely; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate safety precautions are taken to prevent injury to any person or damage to any property while the works are being carried out.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s50
section.heading: Interpretation
section.content: For the purposes of this Division, an escalator or any part of an escalator, or any associated equipment or machinery of an escalator, is examined by a registered escalator engineer only if the escalator or part, or the associated equipment or machinery, is personally examined by the engineer or any other person who is under the direct and proper supervision of the engineer at the place at which the examination takes place.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Examination of escalators before putting into use and operation

subsection.content: Before an escalator is put into use and operation, the responsible person for the escalator must cause a registered escalator engineer to thoroughly examine the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
This section does not apply to an escalator that has been installed and put into use and operation before the date on which section 157 comes into operation.

section.name: s52
section.heading: Examination of escalators after major alterations

subsection.leadIn: If any major alteration has been made in respect of an escalator, before the normal use and operation of the escalator is resumed, the responsible person for the escalator must cause a registered escalator engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to thoroughly examine the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to examine the affected part of the escalator in accordance with section 55(1).

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s53
section.heading: Periodic examination of escalators

subsection.content: The responsible person for an escalator must cause the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery to be thoroughly examined by a registered escalator engineer at intervals not exceeding the period specified in or determined under Part 5 of Schedule 5.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s54
section.heading: Issue of safety certificates by registered escalator engineers

subsection.content: A registered escalator engineer who undertakes to examine an escalator must ensure that the escalator is thoroughly examined by the engineer.

A registered escalator engineer who undertakes to examine any associated equipment or machinery of an escalator must ensure that the associated equipment or machinery is thoroughly examined by the engineer.

If on examination under this section, the registered escalator engineer is of the opinion that the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery are of good design and construction and in safe working condition, the engineer may issue to the responsible person specified in subsection (8) a certificate in respect of the escalator certifying that the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery are in safe working order.
The certificate referred to in subsection (3) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: If on examination under this section, the registered escalator engineer is of the opinion that the escalator or any of its associated equipment or machinery is not of good design and construction or is not in safe working condition, the engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not issue a certificate under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must within 24 hours after the examination is completed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: notify in writing the responsible person specified in subsection (9) of the reasons for not issuing the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: report to the Director the result of the examination and the opinion of the engineer.

subsection.content: The report under subsection (5)(b)(ii) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (5) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the escalator concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (5)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the escalator concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

section.name: s55
section.heading: Issue of safety certificates by registered escalator engineers after major alterations

subsection.content: A registered escalator engineer who undertakes to examine any affected part of an escalator must ensure that the escalator and its associated equipment or machinery are thoroughly examined by the engineer, in so far as is necessary to determine whether the affected part is in safe working order.

If on examination under subsection (1), the registered escalator engineer is of the opinion that the affected part is of good design and construction and in safe working condition, the engineer may issue to the responsible person specified in subsection (7) a certificate in respect of the escalator certifying that the affected part is in safe working order.
The certificate referred to in subsection (2) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: If on examination under subsection (1), the registered escalator engineer is of the opinion that the affected part is not in safe working order, the engineer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not issue a certificate under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must within 24 hours after the examination is completed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: notify in writing the responsible person specified in subsection (8) of the reasons for not issuing the certificate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: report to the Director the result of the examination and the opinion of the engineer.

subsection.content: The report under subsection (4)(b)(ii) must be in the specified form and must contain the information and particulars specified in the form.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (2)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the escalator concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4)—
subsection.def: responsible person (負責人) means the responsible person for the escalator concerned who employs or arranges (whether or not through any other person) the engineer referred to in that subsection to carry out the examination.

section.name: s56
section.heading: Issue etc. of use permits

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 150, the Director may on application issue in respect of an escalator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a permit, in the specified form, permitting the escalator to be put into use and operation; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a permit, in the specified form, permitting the escalator to continue to be used and operated.

subsection.content: The Director may refuse to issue a permit under subsection (1) if there is a contravention of section 143 in relation to the escalator.
The Director must not issue a permit under subsection (1) unless the Director is satisfied that the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery are in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to refuse an application or refuse to issue a permit under this section, the Director must as soon as reasonably practicable after making the decision notify in writing the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the work that in the opinion of the Director is necessary to put the escalator or any of its associated equipment or machinery in safe working order.

subsection.content: This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under sections 41 and 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s57
section.heading: Validity period of use permits

subsection.leadIn: A permit issued under section 56(1)(a) relating to an examination of an escalator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on the last day of the 6-month period beginning on the date immediately after the date of completion of the examination.

subsection.leadIn: A permit issued under section 56(1)(b) relating to an examination of an escalator that was completed within the period of 2 months ending on the date of expiry of the preceding use permit of the escalator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on the last day of the 6-month period beginning on the date immediately after the date of expiry of the preceding use permit.

subsection.leadIn: Any other permit issued under section 56(1)(b) relating to an examination of an escalator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: expires on the last day of the 6-month period beginning on the date immediately after the date of completion of the examination.

section.name: s58
section.heading: Issue etc. of resumption permits

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, the Director may on application issue in respect of an escalator a permit, in the specified form, permitting the use and operation of the escalator to be resumed after a major alteration is made in respect of the escalator.
The Director may refuse to issue a permit under subsection (1) if there is a contravention of section 143 in relation to the escalator.
The Director must not issue a permit under subsection (1) unless the Director is satisfied that the affected part of the escalator is in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to refuse an application or refuse to issue a permit under this section, the Director must as soon as reasonably practicable after making the decision notify in writing the applicant of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the work that in the opinion of the Director is necessary to put the affected part of the escalator in safe working order.

subsection.content: This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under sections 41 and 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s59
section.heading: Issue of duplicates of use permits and resumption permits

subsection.content: If a permit issued under section 56 or 58 is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged, subject to section 150, the Director may on application issue a duplicate permit to replace the original permit.
A duplicate permit issued under subsection (1) has the same effect as the original permit and is to be treated as having been issued under the section under which the original permit was issued.
On the issue of a duplicate permit, the original permit ceases to be valid.
When making an application for a duplicate permit, the applicant must return the original permit to the Director if it is available to the applicant.
The Director may refuse an application under this section if the applicant contravenes subsection (4).

section.name: s60
section.heading: Prohibition orders

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order served on the responsible person for an escalator prohibit the escalator from being used or operated, or continuing to be used or operated, if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the escalator has been used or operated, or is or is likely to be used or operated, in contravention of section 43;

paragraph.name: b
