paragraph.content: the responsible person has contravened section 46(2)(b) or 53(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the escalator if used or operated, or continued to be used or operated, will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the escalator, or any of its associated equipment or machinery, is not in safe working order; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: it is otherwise desirable to do so in the interest of safety.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the order is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: A person who uses or operates an escalator in contravention of an order made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

A person who causes or permits any other person to use or operate an escalator in contravention of an order made under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the use or operation was prohibited under an order made under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (4) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the use or operation was prohibited under an order made under subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contravention occurred without the person’s consent or connivance and that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the use or operation of the escalator.

subsection.content: Subsections (3) and (4) do not apply to the use or operation of an escalator in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

Subsections (3) and (4) do not apply if the use or operation of the escalator is for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Ordinance.

section.name: s61
section.heading: Director’s power to disconnect supply of electricity

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that an escalator is being used or operated, or is likely to be used or operated, in contravention of an order made under section 60, the Director may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: disconnect or, if any escalator works of the escalator are undertaken by a registered escalator contractor, by order served on the contractor direct the contractor to disconnect, the supply of electricity to the escalator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out, or by order served on the contractor mentioned in paragraph (a) direct the contractor to carry out, any work that is necessary to prevent, as far as possible, any person from reconnecting the supply of electricity to the escalator before written permission has been obtained from the Director to reconnect the supply.

subsection.content: If the registered escalator contractor on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the contractor commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: If, without the Director’s written permission, the supply of electricity to an escalator is reconnected by any person after it has been disconnected under subsection (1)(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the responsible person for the escalator,

subsection.continued: each commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (3) to prove that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person charged is the person who reconnected the supply of electricity to the escalator, the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the supply of electricity to the escalator was disconnected under subsection (1)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the person charged is not the person who reconnected the supply of electricity to the escalator but is the responsible person for the escalator—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the offence was committed without the responsible person’s consent or connivance; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the responsible person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the commission of the offence.

section.name: s62
section.heading: Cessation orders in respect of escalator works

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order served on the related person of an escalator direct the person to cease any escalator works that are being carried out in relation to the escalator, if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the escalator works are being carried out in contravention of section 42;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the escalator works are being carried out in a manner that will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is otherwise desirable to do so in the interest of safety.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date on which the order is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士), in relation to an escalator, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible person for the escalator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered escalator contractor (if any) who undertakes the escalator works to which the order relates.

section.name: s63
section.heading: Application for cancellation of prohibition orders and cessation orders

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, a person affected by an order under section 60 or 62 may on application request the Director to cancel the order.
If the Director decides to refuse an application under subsection (1), the Director must notify in writing the applicant of the decision and the reasons for the decision.
This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under section 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

section.name: s64
section.heading: Examination orders

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that it is desirable in the interest of safety to do so, the Director may by order served on the responsible person for an escalator direct the person to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause the escalator or any part of the escalator, or any associated equipment or machinery of the escalator, to be examined by a registered escalator engineer in the manner and within the period specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit within the period specified in the order a report, in the specified form, prepared by the engineer stating whether the engineer is satisfied that the escalator or the part of the escalator, or the associated equipment or machinery, is in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must state the reasons for making the order; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s65
section.heading: Removal orders

subsection.leadIn: The Director may by order served on the responsible person for an escalator direct the person to remove the escalator or any part of the escalator, or any associated equipment or machinery of the escalator, if the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the escalator or the part, or the associated equipment or machinery, if used or operated, or continued to be used or operated, will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is otherwise necessary to do so in the interest of safety.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date before which the escalator or the part of the escalator, or the associated equipment or machinery, is to be removed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s66
section.heading: Improvement orders

subsection.leadIn: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any provision of this Ordinance has been contravened or is being contravened in relation to an escalator or any associated equipment or machinery of an escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an escalator or any associated equipment or machinery of an escalator is in a state that will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any escalator works have been carried out or are being carried out in a manner that will cause or be likely to cause a risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: it is otherwise desirable to do so in the interest of safety,

subsection.continued: the Director may by order served on the related person of the escalator direct the person to carry out any work specified in the order, in order to rectify or remedy or otherwise put an end to the contravention or to eliminate or reduce any risk of injury to any person or damage to any property.

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (1) may specify the manner in which, and the time within which, any work specified in the order must be carried out or completed.

subsection.leadIn: An order made under subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: must state—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the reasons for making the order; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the date before which the work must be completed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may contain any conditions the Director may reasonably impose.

subsection.content: If a person on whom an order is served under subsection (1), without reasonable excuse, contravenes the order, the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: RelatedPerson
def.leadIn: related person (有關連人士), in relation to an escalator, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the responsible person for the escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered escalator contractor (if any) who undertakes the escalator works to which the order relates; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the registered escalator engineer (if any) who engages in the escalator works to which the order relates.

section.name: s67
section.heading: Director’s power to remove escalators or to carry out other works, etc. in case of non-compliance with section 62 or 65

subsection.content: If an order made under section 62, other than an order made on the ground mentioned in section 62(1)(a), is contravened, the Director may without any notice to the responsible person for the escalator carry out any work and provide any service necessary for carrying out the work, to ensure that the order will be complied with.

subsection.leadIn: If an order made under section 65 is contravened, the Director may without any notice to the responsible person for the escalator—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: remove the escalator or any part of the escalator, or any associated equipment or machinery of the escalator, to remedy the contravention; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: carry out any work and provide any service necessary for carrying out the work to remedy the contravention.

subsection.leadIn: In any case, if there are reasonable grounds to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is necessary to do so to eliminate or reduce any grave or imminent risk of injury to any person or damage to any property; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is otherwise necessary to do so in the interest of safety,

subsection.continued: the Director may without notice to the responsible person for the escalator carry out any work in relation to the escalator, and provide any service necessary for carrying out the work.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Subcontracting restricted

subsection.content: Except with the written approval of the Director, a registered escalator contractor who undertakes any escalator works must not subcontract the works or any part of the works to any other person who is not a registered escalator contractor.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
This section does not apply to any works concerning the installation or demolition of an escalator.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Display of use permits

subsection.content: The responsible person for an escalator must ensure that the use permit for the time being in force in respect of the escalator is displayed at all times in a conspicuous position adjacent to a landing of the escalator.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Incidents to be reported to Director

subsection.leadIn: If there is an incident relating to an escalator, the responsible person for the escalator must within 24 hours after the incident comes to the person’s knowledge, notify in writing the Director and the following person of the incident—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered escalator contractor who currently undertakes any escalator works in respect of the escalator; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if paragraph (a) does not apply, the registered escalator contractor who most recently has undertaken any escalator works in respect of the escalator.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), the registered escalator contractor who is notified under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause a registered escalator engineer to investigate the incident and to prepare and complete, within 7 days after the date on which the contractor is notified under subsection (1), a full report of the investigation that complies with any regulation made under section 154; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: submit to the Director the report within the period specified in paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: If for any reason the contractor who is notified under subsection (1) is of the opinion that a full report is unable to be submitted as required under subsection (2), the contractor must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: notify in writing the Director of the fact within 3 days after the date on which the contractor is notified under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: cause the registered escalator engineer referred to in subsection (2)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to prepare and complete, within the period specified in paragraph (a), a preliminary report of the investigation that complies with any regulation made under section 154; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to prepare and complete, within 14 days after the date on which the incident occurs or a longer period that the Director may approve, a full report of the investigation that complies with any regulation made under section 154; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: submit to the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the preliminary report within the period specified in paragraph (a); and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the full report within the period within which the report is required to be completed under paragraph (b)(ii).

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Investigation of incidents by Director

subsection.content: If an incident relating to an escalator has come to the knowledge of the Director, the Director may carry out an investigation in respect of the incident, or cause any other enforcement officer to carry out the investigation.

For the purposes of carrying out an investigation under subsection (1), the Director or any other enforcement officer may request the responsible person for the escalator concerned, and the responsible registered escalator contractor (if any), to provide without charge any assistance or information that the Director or the officer may reasonably require for carrying out the investigation.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a request under subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: responsible registered escalator contractor (負責的註冊自動梯承辦商) means the registered escalator contractor who is required under section 70(2) to cause a registered escalator engineer to investigate the incident.

part.name: P4

section.heading: Appointment of Registrar
section.content: The Secretary may appoint a person to be the Registrar of Registered Contractors, Engineers and Workers (Lifts and Escalators) for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s73
section.heading: General functions of Registrar

subsection.leadIn: The functions of the Registrar are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to receive and consider applications for registration or renewal of registration under this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to collect from applicants for registration or renewal of registration the prescribed fees in relation to the applications; and

paragraph.content: to perform other functions conferred or imposed on the Registrar under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The Registrar may do all things necessary for, or incidental or conducive to, the performance of the Registrar’s functions under this Ordinance.

subdivision.heading: Registration and Renewal of Registration of Lift Contractors

section.name: s74
section.heading: Registration—lift contractors

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, the Registrar may on application register a person as a lift contractor for all kinds of lift works.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not grant a registration under subsection (1) unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirements for an applicant set out in Part 2 of Schedule 8 are satisfied; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar is satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to be registered under that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: In considering whether an applicant is a fit and proper person to be registered under subsection (1), the Registrar must in particular take into account—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the applicant has and is capable of maintaining the necessary facilities, resources and workforce to carry out lift works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the applicant is capable of obtaining technical assistance or other support from any other person, including a lift manufacturer, in case this is required.

section.name: s75
section.heading: Renewal of registration—lift contractors

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, the Registrar may on application renew a registration granted under section 74.
The Registrar may refuse an application made under this section if it is not made within the period specified by the Registrar.

subsection.leadIn: In considering whether an applicant is a fit and proper person to continue to perform the functions conferred or imposed on the applicant under the registration of which renewal is sought under this section, the Registrar must in particular take into account—

paragraph.content: whether the applicant has and is capable of maintaining the necessary facilities, resources and workforce to carry out lift works; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the applicant is capable of obtaining technical assistance or other support from any other person, including a lift manufacturer, in case this is required.

section.heading: Expiry of registration and renewed registration

subsection.leadIn: A registration under section 74—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: takes effect on the date specified by the Registrar (specified date); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless cancelled or suspended, expires on the date immediately before the 5th anniversary of the specified date.

subsection.leadIn: A renewal of registration under section 75—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: takes effect on the date immediately after the date of expiry of the registration or at the time of renewal, whichever is the later (effective date); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless cancelled or suspended, expires on the date immediately before the 5th anniversary of the effective date.

subsection.content: If an application is made under section 74 or 75, the Registrar must within 90 days after the date of receipt of the application, notify in writing the applicant of the decision.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar decides—

paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain any information relating to the registration granted or renewed that the Registrar considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If there is a change in the name of a registered person, subject to section 150, the Registrar may on application issue to the registered person a replacement certificate of registration.
A replacement certificate of registration under subsection (4) has the same effect as, and is equivalent to, the certificate of registration it replaces.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant provision (有關條文) means section 74, 75, 78, 79, 82, 83, 86, 87, 90, 91, 94 or 95.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Issue of registration cards on registration or renewal of registration

subsection.content: If the Registrar decides to grant any registration or renewal of registration to a person under a relevant provision, the Registrar may issue a registration card to the person.

If the Registrar considers it appropriate to do so, the Registrar may, on request, issue to the person mentioned in subsection (1) a single registration card in respect of all registrations and renewals granted to the person under the relevant provisions.

subsection.leadIn: A registration card issued under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain any information relating to the registration granted or renewed that the Registrar considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If there is a change in the name of a registered person, subject to section 150, the Registrar may on application issue to the registered person a replacement registration card.
A replacement registration card issued under subsection (4) has the same effect as, and is equivalent to, the registration card it replaces.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: relevant provision (有關條文) means section 78, 79, 82, 83, 90, 91, 94 or 95.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Issue of duplicates of registration certificates and registration cards

subsection.content: If a certificate of registration (original certificate) is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged, subject to section 150, the Registrar may on application issue to the certificate holder a duplicate certificate to replace the original certificate.

If a registration card (original card) is lost, destroyed, defaced or damaged, subject to section 150, the Registrar may on application issue to the card holder a duplicate card to replace the original card.
A duplicate certificate or duplicate card issued under subsection (1) or (2) has the same effect as, and is equivalent to the original certificate or original card.
On the issue of a duplicate certificate or duplicate card, the original certificate or original card ceases to be valid.

When making an application for a duplicate certificate or duplicate card, the certificate holder or card holder must return the original certificate or original card to the Registrar if it is available to the certificate holder or card holder.
The Registrar may refuse to issue a duplicate certificate or duplicate card to the certificate holder or card holder if the holder contravenes subsection (5).

section.name: s101
section.heading: Cancellation of registrations etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar may cancel the registration of a registered person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person requests the cancellation in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Registrar is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the person has died or, if the person has been registered under section 74 or 86, the person ceases to carry on business as a lift contractor or escalator contractor;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the person no longer complies with the applicable requirements for the registration or renewal of the registration;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the person was not at the time of the registration entitled to be so registered;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the person contravenes any provision of this Ordinance;

subparagraph.name: v
subparagraph.content: the person contravenes any condition of the registration; or

subparagraph.name: vi
subparagraph.content: the person is otherwise not fit and proper to continue to be registered under the relevant provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar intends to cancel the registration of a person on any of the grounds mentioned in subsection (1), the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must notify in writing the person of the intention and the reasons for the proposed cancellation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not cancel the registration before the end of the period of 14 days immediately after the date on which the person is notified under paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not cancel the registration of a person on any of the grounds mentioned in subsection (1), if before the end of the period referred to in subsection (2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a), the person withdraws the request;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)(i), the Registrar is satisfied that the person is not dead or, if the person has been registered under section 74 or 86, has not otherwise ceased to carry on business as a lift contractor or escalator contractor;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)(ii), the Registrar is satisfied that the person complies with the applicable requirements for the registration or renewal of the registration;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)(iii), the Registrar is satisfied that the person was at the time of the registration entitled to be so registered;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)(iv), the Registrar is satisfied that the person has not contravened the provision concerned;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)(v), the Registrar is satisfied that the person has not contravened the condition concerned; and

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b)(vi), the Registrar is satisfied that the person is fit and proper to continue to be registered under the relevant provision of this Ordinance.

section.name: s102
section.heading: Suspension of registration etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Registrar may suspend the registration of a registered person if the Registrar is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person no longer complies with the applicable requirements for the registration or renewal of the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person contravenes any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person contravenes any condition of the registration; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person is otherwise not fit and proper to continue to be registered under the relevant provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar intends to suspend the registration of a person on any of the grounds mentioned in subsection (1), the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must notify in writing the person of the intention, the reasons for the proposed suspension and the proposed period of suspension; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may not suspend the registration before the end of the period of 14 days immediately after the date on which the person is notified under paragraph (a).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must not suspend the registration of a person under subsection (1) on any of the grounds mentioned in subsection (1) if before the end of the period referred to in subsection (2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a), the Registrar is satisfied that the person complies with the applicable requirements for the registration or renewal of the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b), the Registrar is satisfied that the person has not contravened the provision concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(c), the Registrar is satisfied that the person has not contravened the condition concerned; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(d), the Registrar is satisfied that the person is fit and proper to continue to be registered under the relevant provision of this Ordinance.

section.name: s103
section.heading: Registrar to notify decisions under sections 101 and 102

subsection.leadIn: If the Registrar decides to make any cancellation under section 101 or suspension under section 102, the Registrar must notify in writing the registered person affected by the decision of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Registrar’s decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation or suspension is to take effect.

subsection.content: Unless the Registrar decides otherwise, a cancellation or suspension under section 101 or 102 is to take effect despite the fact that an appeal is or is to be made under Part 6 against the decision of the Registrar or the appeal board.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Return of certificates of registration and registration cards to Registrar on cancellation or suspension, etc.

subsection.leadIn: A person whose registration is cancelled under section 101, other than on a ground mentioned in section 101(1)(b)(i), or suspended under section 102 must, not later than 14 days after being notified by the Registrar under section 103, return to the Registrar—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the certificate of registration issued to the person in respect of the registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the registration card issued to the person that contains information in respect of the registration.

subsection.content: If the registration card required to be returned under subsection (1)(b) is a card issued under section 99(2), the Registrar may on receiving the card returned under that subsection and on written request, issue to the card holder under section 99 a card containing information relating to the registration or registrations of the person that is or are not affected by the cancellation or suspension.
A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 1.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Registers

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must establish and keep the following registers for the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a register of every person to whom registration is granted under section 74 or whose registration is renewed under section 75 (Register of Lift Contractors);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a register of every person to whom registration is granted under section 86 or whose registration is renewed under section 87 (Register of Escalator Contractors);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a register of every person to whom registration is granted under section 78 or whose registration is renewed under section 79 (Register of Lift Engineers);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a register of every person to whom registration is granted under section 90 or whose registration is renewed under section 91 (Register of Escalator Engineers);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a register of every person to whom registration is granted under section 82 or whose registration is renewed under section 83 (Register of Lift Workers);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a register of every person to whom registration is granted under section 94 or whose registration is renewed under section 95 (Register of Escalator Workers).

subsection.content: The Registrar may keep a register mentioned in subsection (1) in any form the Registrar considers appropriate so long as the information contained in it is capable of being reproduced in a legible form.

subsection.leadIn: A register under subsection (1) must contain the following information in relation to each person in respect of whom the register is established and kept under that subsection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration number assigned to the person on granting the registration under section 98(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the validity period of the registration granted or renewed (as the case requires);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if the register is the Register of Lift Workers or the Register of Escalator Workers, the kind of lift works or escalator works in respect of which the person is granted registration or the registration is renewed (as the case requires);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: if the registration is suspended under section 102(1), a note that reflects the suspension, including the suspension period.

subsection.content: A register under subsection (1) may contain any other information or particulars relating to the administration or implementation of this Ordinance that the Director considers appropriate.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Registers available for public inspection
section.content: For the purposes of enabling a member of the public to ascertain whether a person is registered under this Part and, if the person is so registered, whether the registration of the person is in force, a register under section 105(1) must be available for public inspection, free of charge, at the place and at the reasonable time that the Registrar may specify.

section.name: s107
section.heading: What is a disciplinary offence

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), a registered person commits a disciplinary offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: commits misconduct or neglect in any professional respect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been convicted of an offence under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: has obtained registration or renewal of registration under this Ordinance by fraud or misrepresentation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to attend before a disciplinary board or an appeal board either as a witness or as a person in respect of whom the board is meeting; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of any other offence that may bring their profession into disrepute.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a registered person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: has committed misconduct or neglect in a professional respect;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: has been convicted of an offence under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: has been convicted in Hong Kong or elsewhere of any other offence that may bring their profession into disrepute,

paragraph.continued: informs the Registrar of the misconduct, neglect or conviction when the person applies for registration or renewal of registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar subsequently grant the registration or renewal of registration,

subsection.continued: the person does not commit a disciplinary offence in respect of the disclosed misconduct, neglect or conviction.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Disciplinary board panel

subsection.content: The Secretary must establish a disciplinary board panel for the purposes of this Part.
Schedule 11 has effect with respect to the panel.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Referral of complaints to Secretary

subsection.leadIn: A complaint alleging a disciplinary offence against a registered person may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by any other person by submitting the complaint to the Director.

subsection.content: A complaint under subsection (1) must be in the specified form and must include details of the complaint.

The Director must refer to the Secretary a complaint made under subsection (1) and, if it is a complaint made under subsection (1)(b), subject to subsection (4), must do so within 30 days after the date of receipt of the complaint.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may refuse to refer a complaint submitted to the Director under subsection (1)(b) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the complaint is made anonymously;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the complainant cannot be identified or traced;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the complainant fails to provide any information or particulars the Director reasonably requires in relation to the complaint;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person being complained of has ceased to be a registered person;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Director has previously refused to refer the complaint, or a complaint of a substantially similar nature, to the Secretary under this section;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the complaint, or a complaint of a substantially similar nature, has previously been disposed of by a disciplinary board and the board decided that the person being complained of did not commit the disciplinary offence; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: having regard to all circumstances of the case—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Director is satisfied that on its face no case has been shown for the complaint;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the Director is satisfied that the complaint is frivolous or vexatious or not made in good faith;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the complaint was made after the specified period; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: there are no special circumstances that explain the delay in making the complaint; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: the Director is satisfied for any other reason that referring the complaint to the Secretary is unnecessary.

subsection.content: If the Director decides to refuse to refer to the Secretary a complaint submitted to the Director under subsection (1)(b), the Director must notify in writing the complainant of the fact and the reasons for the decision.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (4)(g)(iii)—

def.name: SpecifiedPeriod
def.leadIn: specified period (指明限期), in relation to a complaint alleging a disciplinary offence against a registered person, means the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date on which the alleged disciplinary offence comes to the knowledge of the complainant (relevant date); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending on the date immediately before the 2nd anniversary of the relevant date.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Establishment, composition, meetings and proceedings of disciplinary board, etc.

subsection.content: Within a period of 21 days beginning on the date on which a complaint is referred to the Secretary under section 109, the Secretary must establish a disciplinary board to consider the complaint.
Schedule 12 has effect with respect to a disciplinary board required to be established under subsection (1).

section.name: s111
section.heading: Hearing of complaints alleging disciplinary offences against registered persons

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of a hearing, the disciplinary board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice signed by the chairperson of the board, order any person to attend before the board and to give evidence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice signed by the chairperson of the board, order any person to produce any document or information relevant to the complaint in respect of which the hearing is conducted; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: authorize any person to inspect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the lift or escalator concerned, or the lift works or escalator works concerned; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the premises at or in which the lift or escalator is situated or is installed or being installed, or at which the lift works or escalator works have been or are being carried out.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes an order under subsection (1)(b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.
In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s112
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 111

subsection.leadIn: After a hearing is completed, the disciplinary board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the board determines that the registered person concerned has not committed the disciplinary offence alleged in the complaint, order that the person be exonerated; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the board determines that the registered person concerned has committed the disciplinary offence alleged in the complaint, make one or more of the following orders—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: order that the person be reprimanded;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if the person has committed the offence in the capacity of a registered lift contractor or registered escalator contractor, order that the person be fined a sum of not more than $100,000;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: if the person has committed the offence in the capacity of a registered lift engineer, registered escalator engineer, registered lift worker or registered escalator worker, order that the person be fined a sum of not more than $10,000;

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: order the Registrar to cancel or suspend the registration of the person.

subsection.content: The board may make any order that it thinks fit with regard to the payment of costs and expenses of the hearing, including the costs and expenses of the parties to the hearing.
All costs, expenses and fine ordered to be paid under this section are recoverable as a civil debt.

subsection.leadIn: If the board decides to make an order under this section, the board must notify in writing the parties to the hearing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an order under subsection (1)(b)(iv), the details of the order.

subsection.content: If the board makes an order under subsection (1)(b)(iv), the Registrar must comply with the order and cancel or suspend the registration concerned accordingly.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Publication of disciplinary orders

subsection.def: A disciplinary board that has decided (original decision) to make an order under section 112(1)(b) may after the relevant date order that its original decision and, if the original decision is appealed against under Part 6, the decision of the authority hearing the appeal be published in the Gazette or in any other publication specified by the board, in the manner the board thinks fit.

subsection.content: An order made under subsection (1) may include any particulars the disciplinary board considers appropriate to acquaint a member of the public with the nature of the matter to which the original decision relates.
For the purposes of the law of defamation, a person does not incur any civil liability by reason only of publishing an order or other particulars permitted under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the original decision is not appealed against under section 115, the last day of the period within which a notice of appeal may be given under section 117(2);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the original decision is appealed against under section 115—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: subject to subparagraph (ii), the date on which the appeal board makes its decision in respect of the appeal; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: if an appeal is made under section 122 to the Court of First Instance, the date on which the Court makes its decision in respect of the appeal.

section.name: s114
section.heading: Privileges and immunities of members of disciplinary board, etc.

subsection.content: The chairperson of a disciplinary board and every other member of the board have, in the performance of their functions under this Part, the same privileges and immunities as a judge of the Court of First Instance in civil proceedings in that Court.

Any person who appears before a disciplinary board, including a party to a hearing and any representative of the party, is entitled to the same privileges and immunities as the person would have in civil proceedings in the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s115
section.heading: Appeals

subsection.leadIn: A person aggrieved by any of the following decisions and orders may appeal to an appeal board against the decision or order in accordance with this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to refuse an application, or to refuse to issue a permit under section 26, 28, 56 or 58;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director under section 29 or 59 to refuse an application for a duplicate permit, or refuse to issue a duplicate permit under that section;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to refuse an application to cancel an order made under section 30, 32, 60 or 62;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to refuse to grant approval under section 38 or 68;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a decision of the Registrar to refuse an application, or to refuse to grant registration or renewal of registration, under section 74, 75, 78, 79, 82, 83, 86, 87, 90, 91, 94 or 95;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a decision of the Registrar to refuse an application for a duplicate certificate or duplicate card under section 100, or refuse to issue a duplicate certificate or duplicate card under that section;

paragraph.name: h
i
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to refuse to refer a complaint to the Secretary under section 109;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: an order of a disciplinary board under section 112;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director to refuse an application under section 148, or to refuse to grant an exemption or to revoke an exemption granted under that section;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: a decision made by any person under any regulation made under section 154, which decision is specified in the regulation as a decision against which an appeal may be made under this section.

subsection.content: Unless the relevant authority decides otherwise, an appeal made under subsection (1) does not affect the decision or order that is the subject of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a decision or order of the Director, the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a decision of the Registrar, the Registrar;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to a decision or order of a disciplinary board, the board; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to a decision of any other person, that other person.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Appeal board panel

subsection.content: The Secretary must establish an appeal board panel for the purposes of this Part.
Schedule 13 has effect with respect to the panel.

section.name: s117
section.heading: How an appeal is to commence

subsection.content: A person who intends to appeal under section 115 must commence an appeal by giving the Director a notice of appeal in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of appeal must be given to the Director within—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a period of 30 days beginning on the date immediately following the date on which the appellant was notified of the decision or order appealed against; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a longer period the Director allows.

subsection.leadIn: The notice of appeal must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: set out the grounds of the appeal and the facts relied on;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be accompanied by a copy of every document that the appellant intends to rely on; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: include particulars of every witness whom the appellant intends to call at the hearing.

subsection.content: If the Director receives a notice of appeal given under this section, the Director must deliver the notice to the Secretary within a period of 14 days beginning on the date immediately following the date on which the Director receives the notice.

section.name: s118
section.heading: Establishment, composition, meetings and proceedings of appeal board, etc.

subsection.content: Within a period of 21 days beginning on the date on which a notice under section 117 is received by the Secretary, the Secretary must establish an appeal board to consider the appeal to which the notice relates.
Schedule 14 has effect with respect to an appeal board required to be established under subsection (1).

section.name: s119
section.heading: Determination of appeal

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of a hearing, the appeal board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: receive evidence on oath;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by notice signed by the chairperson of the board, order any person to attend before the board and to give evidence;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: by notice signed by the chairperson of the board, order any person to produce any document or information relevant to the appeal in respect of which the hearing is conducted; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an appeal against the issue of an order mentioned in section 115(1)(c) or (j) or a decision mentioned in section 115(1)(d), authorize any person to inspect—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the lift or escalator concerned, or the lift works or escalator works concerned; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the premises at or in which the lift or escalator is situated or is installed or being installed, or at which the lift works or escalator works have been or are being carried out.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes an order under subsection (1)(b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.
In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s120
section.heading: Supplementary provisions to section 119

subsection.leadIn: After a hearing is completed, the appeal board may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm or revoke the decision or order that is the subject of the appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: vary the decision or order that is the subject of the appeal; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: substitute the board’s own decision for the decision or order that is the subject of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: If the board decides to revoke or vary the decision or order that is the subject of the appeal, or to substitute the board’s own decision for the decision or order, the board may order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person whose decision or order is so revoked, varied or substituted; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar (if appropriate),

subsection.continued: to take any appropriate action to give effect to the board’s decision, and the person and the Registrar must comply with the order of the board accordingly.

subsection.content: The board may make any order that it thinks fit with regard to the payment of the costs and expenses of the hearing, including the costs and expenses of the parties to the hearing.
All costs and expenses ordered to be paid under this section are recoverable as a civil debt.

subsection.leadIn: If an appeal board makes a decision under subsection (1), the board must notify in writing the parties to the hearing of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the decision of the board, including any order made under subsection (2) or (3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons for the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to an order under subsection (2), the details of the order.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Privileges and immunities of members of appeal board, etc.

subsection.content: The chairperson of an appeal board and every other member of the board have, in the performance of their functions under this Part, the same privileges and immunities as a judge of the Court of First Instance in civil proceedings in that Court.

Any person who appears before an appeal board, including a party to a hearing and any representative of the party, is entitled to the same privileges and immunities as the person would have in civil proceedings in the Court of First Instance.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Appeal to Court of First Instance on point of law

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a decision of an appeal board is final and is not subject to further appeal.
A person aggrieved by the decision of an appeal board may appeal to the Court of First Instance against the decision on a point of law.
Unless the appeal board decides otherwise, an appeal made under subsection (2) does not affect the decision or order that is the subject of the appeal.

subsection.leadIn: The Court may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: confirm the decision of an appeal board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reverse or vary the decision appeal against; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: remit the matter in question to the appeal board concerned with any directions it considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: If the Court decides to reverse or vary the decision of an appeal board, the Court may order—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person whose decision or order is the subject of the appeal in relation to which the appeal board’s decision is made; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Registrar (if appropriate),

subsection.continued: to take any appropriate action to give effect to the Court’s decision, and the person and the Registrar must comply with the order of the Court accordingly.

section.name: s123
section.heading: Director’s power to authorize persons to personally carry out any lift works or escalator works
section.content: The Director may in writing authorize any person who is not a qualified person to personally carry out any lift works or escalator works if, having regard to the particular circumstances of the case, the Director is satisfied that it is consistent with the interest of safety and is appropriate to do so.

section.name: s124
section.heading: Appointment of enforcement officers
section.content: The Director may in writing appoint any public officer attached to the Electrical and Mechanical Services Department to be an enforcement officer for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Delegation
section.content: The Director may in writing delegate to a public officer attached to the Electrical and Mechanical Services Department any of the functions of the Director under this Ordinance.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Confidentiality

subsection.content: This section applies to a person who performs any function under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Except as provided by subsection (3), a person to whom this section applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must preserve and aid in preserving information concerning a trade or business secret that has come to the knowledge of, or into the possession of, the person in the course of the person’s performance of functions under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not disclose or give the information to any other person; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must not suffer or permit any other person to have access to the information.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information in the person’s performance of functions under this Ordinance or in carrying into effect or doing anything authorized by this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information with the consent in writing of the person from whom the information was obtained or received and, if the information relates to another person, with the consent also of that other person;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information with a view to bringing, or otherwise for the purposes of, any disciplinary proceedings or appeal proceedings under this Ordinance, including any proceedings arising from those proceedings;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information with a view to bringing, or otherwise for the purposes of, any civil proceedings under this Ordinance, including any appeal proceedings or other proceedings arising from those civil proceedings;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information with a view to bringing, or otherwise for the purposes of, any criminal proceedings or any investigation carried out under the laws of Hong Kong including any appeal proceedings or other proceedings arising from those criminal proceedings or investigation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: the disclosure or giving of information in the form of a summary compiled from similar information obtained or received from a number of persons under this Ordinance, if the summary is compiled to prevent particulars relating to the business or identity, or the trading particulars, of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: any of those persons who have produced or provided the information; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: any persons to whom the information relates,

paragraph.continued: from being ascertained from the summary;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information which has already been lawfully disclosed or made available to the public;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information for the purposes of seeking advice from, or giving advice by, a counsel or a solicitor or any other professional adviser acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity in connection with any matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the disclosure or giving of information in accordance with an order of a court or in accordance with a law or a requirement made by or under a law.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under this section to prove that at the time of the alleged offence the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: believed that there was lawful authority for the person to disclose or give the information to the other person and the person had no reasonable cause to believe otherwise; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know and had no reasonable cause to believe that the information disclosed or given was information referred to in subsection (2).

section.name: s127
section.heading: Protection of public officers

subsection.content: A public officer, or a person acting under the direction of a public officer, does not incur any personal liability for anything done or omitted to be done by the officer or the person in good faith in the execution or purported execution of this Ordinance.
The protection conferred by subsection (1) does not affect any liability in tort of the Government for the thing done or omitted to be done by the public officer or the person.

section.name: s128
section.heading: Powers to obtain documents and information

subsection.content: If the Director has reasonable grounds to believe that a person has, or may have in the person’s possession or control, any document or information that the Director may reasonably require for the purposes of performing any function of the Director under this Ordinance, the Director may by notice in writing request the person to produce or provide the document or information.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may also specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time and place at which any document or information is to be produced or provided; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manner and form in which any document or information is to be produced or provided.

subsection.content: A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a request under this section commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3 and, if the offence is a continuing offence, to a fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Power to Enter Premises without Warrant

section.name: s129
section.heading: Power to enter non-domestic premises for purposes of section 41 or 71

subsection.content: For the purposes of carrying out an investigation under section 41 or 71, an enforcement officer may without a warrant enter any premises, other than domestic premises, at or in which the lift or escalator concerned is situated or is installed or being installed.

subsection.leadIn: After entering any premises under subsection (1), the officer may exercise any or all of the following powers at the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to require access to and the examination of the lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any permit, certificate or other document relating to the lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any other document or thing or any information that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be relevant to the investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to take and make copies of any permit, certificate, document or information referred to in paragraph (b) or (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to seize, remove and detain anything that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be relevant to the investigation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to take any photograph of anything referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d) or (e).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s130
section.heading: Power to enter non-domestic premises for purposes of section 111(1)(d) or 119(1)(d)

subsection.leadIn: A person authorized under section 111(1)(d) or 119(1)(d) may without a warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: enter at any reasonable time any premises, other than domestic premises, at or in which the lift or escalator concerned is situated or is installed or being installed, or at which the lift works or escalator works concerned have been or are being carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exercise the power conferred under that section.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s131
section.heading: Power to enter non-domestic premises etc. for routine checking

subsection.content: For the purposes of ascertaining whether Part 2 or 3 is or is being complied with, an enforcement officer may, without a warrant enter at any reasonable time any premises, other than domestic premises, at or in which a lift or escalator is situated or is installed or being installed, or at which any lift works or escalator works have been or are being carried out.

subsection.leadIn: After entering any premises under subsection (1), an enforcement officer may, in addition to any other power of the officer under any other provision of this Ordinance, exercise any or all of the following powers at the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to require access to and the examination of the lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require access to the place at which any lift works or escalator works have been or are being carried out and the inspection of any lift works or escalator works that are being carried out at the premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any permit, certificate or other document relating to the lift, escalator, lift works or escalator works mentioned in paragraph (a) or (b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any other document or thing or any information that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be relevant to an offence under Part 2 or 3;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to take and make copies of any permit, certificate, document or information referred to in paragraph (c) or (d);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to seize, remove and detain anything that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be relevant to an offence under Part 2 or 3;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to take any photograph of anything referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) or (f).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Power to Enter Premises with Warrant

section.name: s132
section.heading: Warrant to enter premises for purposes of section 41 or 71

subsection.content: A court may issue a warrant authorizing an enforcement officer to enter any premises if the court is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for believing that an incident has occurred in relation to a lift or escalator situated at or installed or being installed in the premises.
Unless otherwise specified in it, a warrant issued under this section continues in force until the purposes for which the entry is necessary have been satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: An enforcement officer authorized by a warrant issued under this section to enter any premises may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time specified in the warrant or, if no time is specified, at any time enter the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use any force that is reasonable in the circumstances for gaining entry into the premises.

subsection.leadIn: If a warrant is issued under subsection (1) in respect of any premises, the enforcement officer authorized by the warrant to enter the premises may exercise any or all of the following powers at the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to require access to and the examination of the lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any permit, certificate or other document relating to the lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any other document or thing or any information that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be relevant to the investigation;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to take and make copies of any permit, certificate, document or information referred to in paragraph (b) or (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to seize, remove and detain anything that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be relevant to the investigation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to take any photograph of anything referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), or (e).

subsection.content: An enforcement officer may call on any person the officer considers necessary to assist the officer in the exercise of any power under this section.
A person assisting an enforcement officer in executing a warrant issued under this section also has the powers conferred on the officer under this section.
In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s133
section.heading: Warrant to enter premises for purposes of section 111(1)(d)

subsection.leadIn: A court may issue a warrant authorizing any person authorized under section 111(1)(d) to enter any premises and exercise the power conferred under that section if the court is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for believing that a disciplinary offence has been, is being or may have been committed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to the lift or escalator situated at or installed or being installed in the premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any lift works or escalator works that have been or are being carried out at the premises.

subsection.content: Unless otherwise specified in it, a warrant issued under subsection (1) continues in force until the purposes for which the entry is necessary have been satisfied.
In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s134
section.heading: Warrant to enter premises for purposes of section 119(1)(d)

subsection.content: A court may issue a warrant authorizing any person authorized under section 119(1)(d) to enter any premises and exercise the power conferred under that section if the court is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for believing that the lift or escalator concerned is situated at or installed or being installed in the premises, or the lift works or escalator works concerned have been or are being carried out at the premises.
Unless otherwise specified in it, a warrant issued under subsection (1) continues in force until the purposes for which the entry is necessary have been satisfied.
In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s135
section.heading: Warrant to enter and search premises in any other cases

subsection.leadIn: A court may issue a warrant authorizing an enforcement officer to enter and search any premises if the court is satisfied by information on oath that there are reasonable grounds for believing that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under Part 2 or 3 has been or is being committed at the premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is or may be at the premises anything that is or contains evidence of the commission of an offence under Part 2 or 3.

subsection.content: Unless otherwise specified in it, a warrant issued under this section continues in force until the purposes for which the entry is necessary have been satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: An enforcement officer authorized by a warrant issued under this section to enter and search any premises may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at the time specified in the warrant or, if no time is specified, at any time enter and search the premises; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: use any force that is reasonable in the circumstances for gaining entry into the premises.

subsection.leadIn: If a warrant is issued under subsection (1) in respect of any premises, an enforcement officer authorized by the warrant to enter and search the premises may exercise any or all of the following powers at the premises—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to stop and require any person found at the premises whom the officer has reasonable grounds to believe has committed or is committing an offence under Part 2 or 3—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to state the person’s name, correspondence address and contact telephone number; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to produce for inspection the person’s proof of identity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to require access to and the examination of any lift or escalator situated at or installed or being installed in the premises;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to require access to the place at which any lift works or escalator works have been or are being carried out and the inspection of any lift works or escalator works that are being carried out at the premises;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any permit, certificate or other document relating to the lift, escalator, lift works or escalator works mentioned in paragraph (b) or (c);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to require the production or provision of and examine any other document or thing or any information that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be or to contain evidence of an offence under Part 2 or 3;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to take and make copies of any permit, certificate, document or information referred to in paragraph (d) or (e);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to seize, remove and detain anything that the officer has reasonable grounds to believe to be or to contain evidence of the commission of an offence under Part 2 or 3;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to take any photograph of anything referred to in paragraph (a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f) or (g).

subsection.content: An enforcement officer may call on any person the officer considers necessary to assist the officer in the exercise of any power under this section.
A person assisting an enforcement officer in executing a warrant issued under this section also has the powers conferred on an enforcement officer under this section.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (4)(a)—
subsection.def: proof of identity (身分證明文件) means proof of identity as defined by section 17B(1) of the Immigration Ordinance (Cap. 115).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a lift or escalator includes any part of the lift or escalator and any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Offences on obstruction and contravention of requirements

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, contravenes a requirement under section 129, 131, 132 or 135; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: wilfully obstructs any person in the exercise of any power under section 129, 130, 131, 132, 133, 134 or 135.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1)(a) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (1)(b) is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Duty to Produce Evidence of Authority

section.name: s137
