section.heading: Duty to produce evidence of authority
section.leadIn: A person exercising any power under this Part, including executing a warrant, must, if requested, produce for inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: documentary evidence of the person’s identity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if applicable) documentary evidence of the appointment under section 124 or delegation under section 125; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (if applicable) the warrant.

section.name: s138
section.heading: Return and forfeiture of things seized

subsection.leadIn: If an offence is prosecuted under this Ordinance, the court may, on its own motion or on application, order that any thing seized under Subdivision 2 or 3 in respect of which the prosecution is brought—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be returned to the person from whom it was seized or to its owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be forfeited to the Government.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies whether or not any person charged in the proceedings is convicted of the offence.
An enforcement officer may apply to the court for an order to dispose of a thing seized under Subdivision 2 or 3, whether or not a prosecution is brought in respect of that thing.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under subsection (3), the court may order that the thing concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be returned to the person from whom it was seized or to its owner; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be forfeited to the Government.

section.name: s139
section.heading: Compensation for seizure etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), if a thing is seized under Subdivision 2 or 3, the Government is liable to compensate the owner of the thing for any loss suffered by the owner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by reason of the seizure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by reason that the thing is lost or damaged during the time when the thing is seized or detained.

subsection.content: The owner is not entitled to compensation for the loss if the thing is forfeited to the Government by an order of the court under section 138, unless the order is made because the owner of the thing is unknown or cannot be found at the time when the order is made.

In any proceedings against the Government in respect of a claim for compensation on any of the grounds referred to in subsection (1), the amount of the compensation recoverable is an amount that is just and equitable in all the circumstances of the case.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances referred to in subsection (3) include the conduct and comparative blameworthiness of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the owner of the thing seized;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person in charge or in control of the thing at the time when the thing was seized;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any agent of the person specified in paragraph (a) or (b); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the public officer and any other person concerned.

subsection.content: Proceedings in respect of a claim for compensation on the ground referred to in subsection (1)(a) must commence within the period of 6 months beginning on the date immediately after the date on which the thing was seized.

subsection.leadIn: Proceedings in respect of a claim for compensation on the ground referred to in subsection (1)(b) must commence within the period of 6 months beginning on the date immediately after whichever of the following is the earlier—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the owner discovers the existence of the ground;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the owner could, by the exercise of due diligence, have discovered the existence of the ground.

subsection.leadIn: A claim for compensation under this section may be made—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the Small Claims Tribunal, if the claim is within the jurisdiction of the Tribunal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the District Court, irrespective of the amount claimed.

section.name: s140
section.heading: Miscellaneous offences

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in purported compliance with a requirement imposed under this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: produces any document or provides any information that the person knows to be false or misleading in a material respect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: produces any document or provides any information that the person ought reasonably to have known to be false or misleading in a material respect.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person wilfully misuses, or interferes with, or causes misuse or interference with, a lift or escalator, or any part of a lift or escalator, or any associated equipment or machinery of the lift or escalator.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: defaces or otherwise interferes with a copy of an order issued under Division 4 of Part 2 or Division 4 of Part 3; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: removes a copy of an order issued under Division 4 of Part 2 or Division 4 of Part 3 that is displayed under section 149(2)(b) on a conspicuous part of a building, lift or escalator.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1)(a) or (b) is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 3.
A person who commits an offence under subsection (3)(a) or (b) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s141
section.heading: Offences committed by bodies corporate and partners

subsection.content: If a person by whom an offence under this Ordinance is committed is a body corporate, and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of, a director, manager or secretary of the body corporate or any other person concerned in the management of the body corporate, the director, manager, secretary or other person also commits the offence.

If a person by whom an offence under this Ordinance is committed is a partner in a partnership, and it is proved that the offence was committed with the consent or connivance of, or was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of, any other partner in the partnership or any other person concerned in the management of the partnership, the other partner or person also commits the offence.

An offence under this Ordinance committed by a body corporate is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to neglect or omission on the part of, a director, manager or secretary of the body corporate or any other person if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the director, manager, secretary or other person was concerned in the management of the body corporate.

An offence under this Ordinance committed by a partner in a partnership is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to neglect or omission on the part of, any other partner in the partnership or any other person if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the other partner or person was concerned in the management of the firm.

subsection.leadIn: The presumption under subsection (3) or (4) is rebutted by a person charged with an offence under this Ordinance by virtue of that subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance and was not attributable to the person’s neglect or omission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: offence (罪行) does not include a disciplinary offence.

section.name: s142
section.heading: Time limit for prosecutions
section.content: A prosecution under this Ordinance may be commenced within the period of 6 months beginning on the date immediately after the date on which the offence is discovered by, or comes to the notice of, the Director.

section.name: s143
section.heading: Lifts and escalators to be marked with identification marks

subsection.leadIn: If a building has more than one lift, more than one escalator or any number of lifts and escalators—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: each lift and escalator of the building must be marked with an identification mark recognized by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a plan showing the position and identification mark of each lift and escalator must be submitted to the Director.

subsection.leadIn: If there is a contravention of subsection (1), the Director may take any one or both of the following actions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause the lift or escalator to be marked with an identification mark;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: cause a plan described in subsection (1)(b) to be prepared and sent to any responsible person for the lift or escalator.

section.name: s144
section.heading: Recovery of costs

subsection.leadIn: The Director may recover—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the costs of any work carried out or service provided by the Director under section 37 or 67; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the costs of preparing any plan under section 143.

subsection.content: The costs referred to in subsection (1)(a) include any costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Director for or in connection with the purposes of carrying out the work or providing the service.
The costs referred to in subsection (1)(b) include any costs and expenses reasonably incurred by the Director for or in connection with the purposes of preparing the plan.
The Director may certify in writing the costs due and the name of any person who is liable for the costs, apportioning the costs if appropriate.
The Director must serve a copy of the certificate on each person who is liable to pay the costs.

subsection.def: If any costs under subsection (1) are not fully paid on or before the 30th day (relevant date) after the day on which the certificate is served on a person under subsection (5), then beginning on the day immediately after the relevant date, simple interest calculated at the rate of 10% per annum is to be charged on the amount for the time being unpaid, and the interest is recoverable as part of the costs liable to be paid by the person.

subsection.content: Payment of any costs under this section by any person does not affect the right of the person to recover the payment from any other person who is liable to pay the costs, and any costs recoverable under this section are recoverable as a civil debt due to the Government.

section.name: s145
section.heading: Issue of codes of practice

subsection.content: The Director may issue any code of practice that in the Director’s opinion is suitable for providing practical guidance in respect of any matter concerning the safety of lifts or escalators, including providing practical guidance in respect of the use and operation of lifts or escalators and providing practical guidance to persons who carry out any lift works or escalator works.

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is issued under subsection (1), the Director must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the code is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the purposes for which the code is issued.

subsection.content: The Director may from time to time revise the whole or any part of a code of practice issued under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice is revised under subsection (3), the Director must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code or part so revised;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the revision is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the purposes for which the code is revised.

subsection.content: The Director may revoke a code of practice or any part of a code of practice issued or revised under this section.

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice or part of a code of practice issued or revised under this section is revoked under subsection (5), the Director must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code or part so revoked; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the revocation is to take effect.

section.name: s146
section.heading: Approval of codes of practice etc. issued by other persons

subsection.content: The Director may approve a code of practice, or any part of a code of practice, issued or proposed to be issued by any other person, if the Director is satisfied that the code or part is suitable for providing practical guidance in respect of any matter concerning the safety of lifts or escalators, including providing practical guidance in respect of the use and operation of lifts or escalators and providing practical guidance to persons who carry out any lift works or escalator works.

subsection.leadIn: If a code of practice or part of a code of practice is approved under subsection (1), the Director must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the code or part so approved;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the code or part is to take effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: specify the purposes for which the code or part is approved.

subsection.content: The Director may from time to time approve any revision or proposed revision of the whole or any part of a code of practice approved under subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: If any revision or proposed revision is approved under subsection (3), the Director must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the revision or proposed revision so approved; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the approval is to take effect.

subsection.content: The Director may withdraw any approval given under this section.

subsection.leadIn: If an approval is withdrawn under subsection (5), the Director must by notice published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: identify the approval so withdrawn; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify the date on which the approval is to cease to have effect.

section.name: s147
section.heading: Use of codes of practice in legal proceedings

subsection.content: A failure by a person to observe a provision of a code of practice does not of itself make the person liable to any civil or criminal proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1), if in any legal proceedings the court is satisfied that a code of practice or any part of a code of practice is relevant to determining a matter that is in issue in the proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the code or part is admissible in evidence in the proceedings; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: proof that the person contravened or did not contravene a relevant provision of the code of practice may be relied on by a party to the proceedings as tending to establish or negate that matter.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an appeal board;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a court as defined by section 3 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a disciplinary board; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a magistrate;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the proceedings of an appeal board; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings of a disciplinary board.

section.name: s148
section.heading: Exemptions

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 150, the Director may on application—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exempt any lift, escalator or person from any or all of the provisions of Part 2 or 3; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exempt any person or any class of person from complying with an order of the Director made under section 30 or 60.

subsection.content: Subject to section 150, the Director may on application exempt a goods lift used in an industrial undertaking other than construction work from all of the provisions of this Ordinance.
An exemption must not be granted under subsection (1) unless the exemption is consistent with the interest of safety.

An exemption must not be granted under subsection (2) unless the Director considers that it is expedient that the lift concerned should comply with the provisions of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59) relating to goods lifts in industrial undertakings.
If the Director decides to refuse an application or refuse to grant an exemption under this section, the Director must in writing state the reasons for the decision.
This section does not affect the general powers of the Director under sections 41 and 46 of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: construction work (建築工程) means construction work as defined by section 2(1) of the Factories and Industrial Undertakings Ordinance (Cap. 59).

section.name: s149
section.heading: Service of notices etc.

subsection.leadIn: A notice or other document (however described), other than an order referred to in subsection (2), permitted or required to be served or sent (however described) under this Ordinance is served or sent if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the Director—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the Director and delivered to the Director’s principal office; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the Director by post addressed to the Director at the Director’s principal office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for an individual—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to and served personally on the individual; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the individual by post addressed to the individual at the individual’s last known address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622)— (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the company and delivered to any officer of the company by hand;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is left at or sent by post to the registered office of the company within the meaning of that Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: it is sent by post addressed to the company at the company’s last known address;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a body corporate (other than a company described in paragraph (c))—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the body and delivered to any place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the body; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the body by post addressed to the body at the body’s last known address; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for a partnership—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the partnership and delivered to any place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the partnership; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is sent to the partnership by post addressed to the partnership at the partnership’s last known address.

subsection.leadIn: An order under section 30, 32, 34, 35, 36, 60, 62, 64, 65 or 66 is served under the section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the order is served in accordance with subsection (1)(b), (c), (d) or (e); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to an order concerning a lift or escalator that forms part of, or is installed or is being installed in, a building, the order is displayed on a conspicuous part of the building in which the lift or escalator is installed or of which the lift or escalator forms a part; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to any other order, the order is displayed on a conspicuous part of the lift or escalator.

section.name: s150
section.heading: Applications to comply with regulations made under section 154 etc.

subsection.content: An application made under a relevant provision must comply with any regulation made under section 154.
The person who makes the application must comply with any other requirement imposed by or under any regulation made under that section in relation to the application.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—

section.name: s151
section.heading: Evidence by documents

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, a copy purporting to be certified by a relevant authority as a true copy of a document or part of a document given, issued or maintained by the authority is admissible in evidence without further proof and in the absence of evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken as certified by the authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is evidence of the matters so certified.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, a document purporting to be given or issued by an authority and purporting to be signed by the authority or any person authorized by the authority in that behalf is admissible in evidence without further proof and, in the absence of evidence to the contrary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is taken as given or issued by the authority and as so signed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is evidence of the facts stated in it.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: relevant authority (有關當局) means the Director or the Registrar.

section.name: s152
section.heading: Paid fees not refundable
section.content: Any prescribed fee paid is not refundable under this Ordinance.

section.name: s153
section.heading: Powers to specify forms
section.content: The Director may specify any form to be used for the purposes of any matter provided for under this Ordinance.

section.name: s154
section.heading: Regulations—General

subsection.content: The Secretary may make regulations for the better carrying out of the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Secretary may by regulation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for applications for the issue of permits, including the information, particulars and documents to be provided in respect of the applications and the period within which the applications are to be made;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide for applications for duplicates of permits, including the information, particulars and documents to be provided in respect of the applications and the period within which the applications are to be made;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for applications for cancellation of orders made by the Director made under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: provide for applications for registration as registered persons and renewal of registration as registered persons, including the information, particulars and documents to be provided in respect of the applications and the period within which the applications are to be made;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: provide for applications for duplicates or replacement of certificates of registration or registration cards, including the information, particulars and documents to be provided in respect of the applications and the period within which the applications are to be made;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: provide for applications for exemptions of lifts, escalators or persons from any or all of the provisions of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: provide for the imposition of requirements by the Director in relation to the applications referred to in paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (f);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: provide for the imposition of requirements by the Registrar in relation to the applications referred to in paragraphs (d) and (e);

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: provide for the duties of responsible persons and registered persons in relation to the safety of lifts or escalators, including duties of responsible persons and registered persons to keep certain documents, log-books and records specified in the regulations and to notify the Director of matters specified in the regulations;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: provide for the preparation and completion of a preliminary report or full report under section 40 or 70, including the information, particulars and documents to be provided in the report;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: provide for the display of notices specified in the regulations, including prohibiting or regulating the removal of, or the obstruction of the display of, such notices;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: require fees to be paid in respect of the applications referred to in paragraphs (a), (b), (c), (d), (e) and (f) and any other matter provided for in this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: prescribe anything that is to be or may be prescribed by a regulation made under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: provide for incidental, consequential and transitional provisions that are necessary and expedient in consequence of the regulations.

subsection.content: Regulations made under this section may prescribe offences for contravention of the regulations, punishable by a fine, imprisonment or both.

The maximum fine that may be prescribed for an offence is level 6 and the maximum imprisonment is 6 months. In addition, in the case of a continuing offence, a further fine not exceeding $5,000 for each day during which the offence continues may be prescribed.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting section 28(5) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1), if a provision of any of the regulations made under this section is to commence on a day to be notified in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the notice may fix different days for the provision to commence for different purposes; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: different notices may fix different days for the provision to commence for different purposes.

section.name: s155
section.heading: Regulations—Fees
section.content: The Secretary may by regulation prescribe the fees payable under this Ordinance.

section.name: s156
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

subsection.content: The Secretary may by order published in the Gazette amend any of the Schedules, other than Schedules 15 and 16.
An order under subsection (1) may contain incidental, consequential, supplemental, transitional or savings provisions that are necessary or expedient in consequence of the order.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Repeal, Transitional and Savings Provisions, and Consequential or Related Amendments

section.name: s157
section.heading: Lifts and Escalators (Safety) Ordinance repealed
section.content: The Lifts and Escalators (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 327) is repealed.

section.name: s158
section.heading: Transitional provision for lifts installed on or before 18 March 1994 or being installed on 18 March 1994

def.name: LiftsRegulations
def.leadIn: Despite the repeal of the Lifts and Escalators (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 327) by section 157, the repealed Building (Lifts) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. E) referred to in section 50 of that Ordinance (Lifts Regulations) continue to apply to a lift that was installed on or before 18 March 1994 or was in the process of being installed on that date, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is a conflict between this Ordinance and the Lifts Regulations, the Lifts Regulations apply in respect of the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director may enforce the Lifts Regulations as if they had been made under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: If the design and construction of a lift referred to in subsection (1) is in accordance with the Lifts Regulations, the design and construction of the lift is to be regarded as good design and construction for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s159
section.heading: Transitional provision for escalators installed on or before 18 March 1994 or being installed on 18 March 1994

def.name: EscalatorsRegulations
def.leadIn: Despite the repeal of the Lifts and Escalators (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 327) by section 157, the repealed Building (Escalators) Regulations (Cap. 123 sub. leg. D) referred to in section 50 of that Ordinance (Escalators Regulations) continue to apply to an escalator that was installed on or before 18 March 1994 or was in the process of being installed on that date, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if there is a conflict between this Ordinance and the Escalators Regulations, the Escalators Regulations apply in respect of the escalator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director may enforce the Escalators Regulations as if they had been made under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: If the design and construction of an escalator referred to in subsection (1) is in accordance with the Escalators Regulations, the design and construction of the escalator is to be regarded as good design and construction for the purposes of this Ordinance.

section.name: s160
section.heading: Transitional and savings provisions, and consequential or related amendments

subsection.content: The transitional and savings provisions specified in Schedule 15 have effect.
The enactments specified in Schedule 16 are amended as set out in that Schedule.

section.name: s161
section.heading: Effect of amendments to sections 82 and 94 by sections 19 and 20 of Schedule 16
section.content: The amendments to sections 82(1) and 94(1) effected by sections 19 and 20 of Schedule 16 (those 2 sections of Schedule 16) do not affect the validity of a registration granted under section 82(1) or 94(1) before those 2 sections of Schedule 16 come into operation*, and an application for renewal of a registration so granted may be made under sections 83 and 95, as appropriate.

def.name: MajorAlteration
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, major alteration (主要更改), in relation to a lift means—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the addition of auxiliary rope-fastening devices for the lift;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the addition of car-levelling devices for the lift;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the addition of any device to enable the lift to be operated at the top of the car of the lift;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the addition of any door to the lift-way, or removal or replacement of any lift-way door, of the lift;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the addition of electrical contacts to the lift-way door or the car door of the lift;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the addition of any interlocking device to the lift-way door or the car door of the lift;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: the addition of one or more than one set of roller guide shoes for the lift;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the addition of one or more than one set of rope equalizers for the lift;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the addition of any safety component or safety equipment for the lift;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: the addition of any switch to enable access to the lift-way of the lift;

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: any change in the number or size of the ropes for supporting the carrier of the lift or its counterweight;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: any change in the size or type of any guide rail of the lift;

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: any change in the type of any interlocking device mentioned in paragraph (g);

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: any change in the type of control or operation of the lift;

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: any modification resulting in an increase in the dead weight of the carrier of the lift;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: any modification resulting in a decrease or increase in the distance that the carrier of the lift travels;

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: any modification resulting in an increase in the rated load of the lift;

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: any modification resulting in an increase in the rated speed of the lift;

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of any controller of the lift;

paragraph.name: u
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of any driving-machine brake of the lift;

paragraph.name: v
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of the driving-machine of the lift; or

paragraph.name: w
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of any safety component (other than a safety circuit that contains any electronic component) or safety equipment for the lift.

def.name: MajorAlteration
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Ordinance, major alteration (主要更改), in relation to an escalator, means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the addition of any safety component or safety equipment for the escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any change in the type of control or operation of the escalator;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any modification resulting in an increase in the speed of the escalator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of any safety equipment for the escalator;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of the drive of the escalator;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of the braking system of the escalator;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of the non-reversal device of the escalator; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: any replacement, including any change in the type, of the overspeed protection device of the escalator.

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.heading: Safety Components for Lifts and Escalators

section.name: s1
section.content: A safety gear, that is to say, a mechanical device the sole or main function of which is to stop a lift and cause the carrier or counterweight (if any) of the lift to remain stationary on the guides if the lift overspeeds or the suspension device of the lift breaks or fails.

section.name: s2
section.content: An overspeed governor, that is to say, a device the sole or main function of which is to activate the safety gear for a lift or counterweight of a lift, if the carrier of the lift attains a predetermined speed.

section.name: s3
section.content: A door locking device for a lift.

section.name: s4
section.content: A buffer, other than an energy accumulation type buffer, for a lift.

section.name: s5
section.content: An ascending car overspeed protection means, that is to say, a device with a function to monitor the speed of the carrier of a lift and, if the carrier is ascending at 115% or more of the rated speed, cause the carrier or the counterweight of the lift to stop or reduce its speed to the maximum impact speed of the counterweight buffer.

section.name: s6
section.content: An unintended car movement protection means, that is to say, a device with a function to prevent unintended movement from a landing of the carrier of a lift when both the landing door and the door of the carrier are not locked.

section.name: s7
section.content: Any safety circuit for a lift that contains any electronic component.

iii

schedule.name: sch12
schedule.heading: Composition, Meetings and Proceedings of Disciplinary Board, etc.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: board member (委員會成員) means a member of a disciplinary board;
complaint (投訴) means a complaint alleging a disciplinary offence against a registered person;
disciplinary board (紀律審裁委員會) means a disciplinary board required to be established under section 110(1) to consider a complaint;
meeting (會議) includes a hearing.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Composition of disciplinary board

subsection.content: A disciplinary board is to consist of 8 members appointed by the Secretary from the members of the disciplinary board panel established under section 108.
The board members must include at least one member from each category constituting the panel.

If, at the time of considering a complaint, a member of the disciplinary board ceases to be a member of the disciplinary board panel other than for any of the reasons under section 5 of Schedule 11, the board member may continue to act as a member of the disciplinary board until a decision is made by the board in respect of the complaint.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Quorum

subsection.content: At a meeting of a disciplinary board, the quorum is 5 board members.

If a board member is disqualified from taking part in a decision or deliberation in respect of a matter under section 8 of this Schedule, the member must be disregarded for the purposes of constituting the quorum for deciding or deliberating on that matter.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Chairperson of disciplinary board
section.content: The board members are to elect a chairperson from among themselves.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Remuneration of board member
section.content: The remuneration, if any, of the chairperson and a board member is to be paid at a rate determined by the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Chairperson to preside at meeting

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), the chairperson elected under section 4 of this Schedule is to preside at any meeting of the disciplinary board.
If, for any reason, the chairperson is not able to preside at a meeting of the board, the board members present at the meeting are to elect from among themselves a member to preside.
All questions for determination are to be decided by a majority of votes of the board members present and voting.
If there is an equality of votes, the member presiding has a casting vote as well as a deliberative vote.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Proceedings before disciplinary board

subsection.leadIn: The parties to a hearing before a disciplinary board are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registered person who is the subject of the complaint; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson of the disciplinary board is to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint the time and place of the hearing; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: notify in writing the parties of that time and place.

subsection.leadIn: A party to the hearing may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: make a representation in person at the hearing; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be represented at the hearing by a counsel or a solicitor or any other person authorized by the party in writing.

subsection.content: A party to the hearing may adduce evidence at any proceedings before the board.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Disclosure of interests of board member
section.leadIn: If a board member has a pecuniary interest, whether direct or indirect, in any matter under consideration at a meeting of the disciplinary board, the member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must before or as soon as practicable after the meeting begins, disclose to the board the fact and the nature of the interest;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must withdraw from the meeting while the board is considering the matter if so required by the meeting; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must not participate in any deliberation or be involved in any determination regarding the matter.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Legal adviser
section.content: The chairperson of a disciplinary board may appoint a counsel or a solicitor to attend any meeting of the board to advise it on any matter that arises during the meeting of the board.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Disciplinary board to determine procedures
section.content: Subject to this Schedule and Part 5, a disciplinary board may determine its own procedures.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Registration of certain persons under repealed Ordinance to be regarded as registration under this Ordinance

subsection.content: A person who, immediately before the relevant date, was a registered lift contractor under the repealed Ordinance and whose registration, but for the coming into operation of section 157, would have continued to be in force on the relevant date is a registered lift contractor under this Ordinance as if the person were registered under section 74(1) on the relevant date, and section 98 applies accordingly.

A person who, immediately before the relevant date, was a registered lift engineer under the repealed Ordinance and whose registration, but for the coming into operation of section 157, would have continued to be in force on the relevant date is a registered lift engineer under this Ordinance as if the person were registered under section 78(1) on the relevant date, and sections 98 and 99 apply accordingly.

A person who, immediately before the relevant date, was a registered escalator contractor under the repealed Ordinance and whose registration, but for the coming into operation of section 157, would have continued to be in force on the relevant date is a registered escalator contractor under this Ordinance as if the person were registered under section 86(1) on the relevant date, and section 98 applies accordingly.

A person who, immediately before the relevant date, was a registered escalator engineer under the repealed Ordinance and whose registration, but for the coming into operation of section 157, would have continued to be in force on the relevant date is a registered escalator engineer under this Ordinance as if the person were registered under section 90(1) on the relevant date, and sections 98 and 99 apply accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The registration of a registered person under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the relevant date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless cancelled or suspended, expires on the date immediately before the 5th anniversary of that date.

part.name: P3
part.heading:
Application of Sections 9, 13, 43 and 45 in Relation to
Certain Major Alterations

section.name: s3
section.heading: Application of sections 9, 13, 43 and 45 in relation to major alterations completed before relevant date

subsection.leadIn: Sections 9 and 13 do not apply in relation to any major alteration made in respect of a lift if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to a lift to which section 13 of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice permitting the use or operation of the lift to be resumed has been issued under the repealed Ordinance in relation to the alteration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an exemption from section 13 of the repealed Ordinance has been granted under section 44 of that Ordinance in respect of the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other lift, the alteration was completed before the relevant date.

subsection.leadIn: Sections 43 and 45 do not apply in relation to any major alteration made in respect of an escalator if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an escalator to which section 13 of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a notice permitting the use or operation of the escalator to be resumed has been issued under the repealed Ordinance in relation to the alteration; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an exemption from section 13 of the repealed Ordinance has been granted under section 44 of that Ordinance in respect of the escalator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other escalator, the alteration was completed before the relevant date.

part.name: P4
part.heading:
Certain Works, etc. Regarded as Periodic Maintenance
Works, etc. under Ordinance

section.name: s4
section.heading: Certain works to be regarded as periodic maintenance works for purposes of section 15(2)(b) or 46(2)(b), etc.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 15(2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift to which section 19 of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, prescribed works last carried out in respect of the lift within the prescribed period (in accordance with that section 19) are to be regarded as periodic maintenance works carried out in respect of the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other lift, periodic maintenance works are taken to have been first carried out in respect of the lift on the relevant date.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of section 46(2)(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to an escalator to which section 19 of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, prescribed works last carried out in respect of the escalator within the prescribed period (in accordance with that section 19) are to be regarded as periodic maintenance works carried out in respect of the escalator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other escalator, periodic maintenance works are taken to have been first carried out in respect of the escalator on the relevant date.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed period (訂明期間) means a period of one month immediately before the relevant date;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift, the inspection, oiling, cleaning and adjusting of the lift, including the inspection, oiling, cleaning and adjusting of all the machinery and equipment connected with the lift and the safety equipment provided for the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an escalator, the inspection, oiling, cleaning and adjusting of the escalator, including the inspection, oiling, cleaning and adjusting of all the machinery and equipment connected with the escalator and the safety equipment provided for the escalator.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Certain examinations and testing to be regarded as thorough examinations for purposes of section 22, 23 or 53

subsection.content: For the purposes of section 22, the prescribed examination last carried out in respect of a lift before the relevant date is to be regarded as a thorough examination carried out in respect of the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery by a registered lift engineer.

For the purposes of section 23, the prescribed examination with load last carried out in respect of a lift before the relevant date (in accordance with the repealed Ordinance) is to be regarded as an examination carried out in respect of the lift and all its associated equipment or machinery by a registered lift engineer in accordance with section 24(2) and (3).

For the purposes of section 53, the prescribed examination last carried out in respect of an escalator before the relevant date is to be regarded as a thorough examination carried out in respect of the escalator and all its associated equipment or machinery by a registered escalator engineer.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (a)(i) of the definition of prescribed examination, a prescribed certificate as defined by section 6(3)(a)(i) of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (a)(ii) of the definition of prescribed examination, a prescribed certificate as defined by section 6(3)(a)(ii) of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (b)(i) of the definition of prescribed examination, a prescribed certificate as defined by section 6(3)(b)(i) of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (b)(ii) of the definition of prescribed examination, a prescribed certificate as defined by section 6(3)(b)(ii) of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of prescribed examination with load, a copy of a certificate delivered by the Director under section 39 of the repealed Ordinance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of prescribed examination with load, a certificate that is issued by a prescribed person relating to an examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift, carried out by the person and that contains a statement of the person to the effect that the person is satisfied that on the date of the examination, the lift was in safe working order;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (1)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to a lift to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift, in respect of which a prescribed certificate has been issued; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to any other lift, examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift, in respect of which a prescribed certificate has been issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for the purposes of subsection (3)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in relation to an escalator to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, examination of the escalator, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the escalator, in respect of which a prescribed certificate has been issued; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in relation to any other escalator, examination of the escalator, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the escalator, in respect of which a prescribed certificate has been issued;

def.name: PrescribedExaminationWithLoad
def.leadIn: prescribed examination with load (有負載訂明檢驗), for the purposes of subsection (2), means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift with load, carried out within the prescribed period and in respect of which a prescribed certificate has been issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any other lift, examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift with load, carried out within the prescribed period and in respect of which a prescribed certificate has been issued;

def.name: PrescribedPeriod
def.leadIn: prescribed period (訂明期間), for the purposes of the definition of prescribed examination with load, means the period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: beginning on the date the 5th anniversary of which is the relevant date; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ending immediately before the relevant date;

subsection.def: prescribed person (訂明人士), for the purposes of paragraph (f) of the definition of prescribed certificate, means a registered lift engineer as defined by section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Certain certificates to be regarded as use permits issued under section 26 or 56

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed certificate of a lift is to be regarded as a use permit of the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed certificate of an escalator is to be regarded as a use permit of the escalator.

subsection.leadIn: Despite sections 27 and 57—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate of a lift that is to be regarded as a use permit of the lift under subsection (1)(a)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to a document under subsection (3)(a)(i)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: begins to have effect as a use permit on the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ceases to have effect as a use permit at midnight on the date specified in the certificate to be the date on or before which the next periodic examination of the lift is required to be carried out; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to a document under subsection (3)(a)(ii)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: begins to have effect as a use permit on the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ceases to have effect as a use permit at midnight on the date immediately before the 1st anniversary of the date on which the examination was carried out; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a certificate of an escalator that is to be regarded as a use permit of the escalator under subsection (1)(b)—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to a document under subsection (3)(b)(i)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: begins to have effect as a use permit on the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ceases to have effect as a use permit at midnight on the date specified in the certificate to be the date on or before which the next periodic examination of the escalator is required to be carried out; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to a document under subsection (3)(b)(ii)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: begins to have effect as a use permit on the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: ceases to have effect as a use permit at midnight on the last day of the 6-month period beginning on the date immediately after the date on which the examination was carried out.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a document is a prescribed certificate of a lift if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to a lift to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the document is a copy of a certificate delivered by the Director under section 39 of the repealed Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the date specified in the document to be the date on or before which the next periodic examination of the lift is required to be carried out is a date on or after the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to any other lift—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the document is a certificate issued by a prescribed person;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the document was issued before the relevant date relating to an examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift, carried out by the person in accordance with the repealed Ordinance on a date not earlier than the date the 1st anniversary of which is the date immediately after the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the document contains a statement of the person to the effect that the person is satisfied that on the date of the examination, the lift was in safe working order; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a document is a prescribed certificate of an escalator if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to an escalator to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the document is a copy of a certificate delivered by the Director under section 39 of the repealed Ordinance; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the date specified in the document to be the date on or before which the next periodic examination of the escalator is required to be carried out is a date on or after the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.leadIn: in relation to any other escalator—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the document is a certificate issued by a prescribed person;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the document was issued before the relevant date relating to an examination of the escalator, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the escalator, carried out by the person in accordance with the repealed Ordinance within the 6-month period immediately before the relevant date; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: the document contains a statement of the person to the effect that the person is satisfied that on the date of the examination, the escalator was in safe working order.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift, a registered lift engineer as defined by section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an escalator, a registered escalator engineer as defined by section 2(1) of the repealed Ordinance.

part.name: P5
part.heading:
Certificates Pending to be Disposed of under
Repealed Ordinance

section.name: s7
section.heading: Certificates pending to be disposed of by Director under section 12(2) or 13(2) of repealed Ordinance

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate has been delivered to the Director under section 12(2) of the repealed Ordinance in respect of a lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fee payable under that section has been paid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: there is any of the following circumstances—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a decision of the Director as to whether the lift or escalator is in safe working order is pending immediately before the relevant date;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a decision of the Director under section 12(3)(b) of that Ordinance to refuse to permit the lift or escalator to be used and operated is under reconsideration by the Director immediately before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: the Director may dispose of the case under section 26 or 56 as if an application under section 26 or 56 had been made in respect of the lift or escalator and the certificate were a certificate under section 24 or 54.

subsection.leadIn: If a certificate has been delivered to the Director under section 13(2) of the repealed Ordinance in respect of a lift or escalator, the fee payable under that section has been paid, and—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director as to whether the affected part of the lift or escalator is in safe working order is pending immediately before the relevant date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision of the Director under section 13(3)(b) of that Ordinance to refuse to permit the use or operation of the lift or escalator to be resumed is under reconsideration by the Director immediately before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: the Director may dispose of the case under section 28 or 58 as if an application under section 28 or 58 had been made in respect of the lift or escalator and the certificate were a certificate issued under section 25 or 55.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a certificate has been delivered to the Director under section 26(1) of the repealed Ordinance in respect of a lift or escalator;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the fee payable under that section has been paid; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the certificate is yet to be disposed of under section 39(1) of that Ordinance by the Director before the relevant date,

subsection.continued: the Director may dispose of the case under section 26 or 56 as if an application under section 26 or 56 had been made in respect of the lift or escalator and the certificate were a certificate issued under section 24 or 54.

subsection.content: In relation to subsection (1), unless the Director has otherwise directed, the lift or escalator concerned may be used or operated, without a use permit, before the Director notifies the person who delivered the certificate to the Director of the Director’s decision as to whether to issue a permit under section 26 or 56 for the lift or escalator.

In relation to subsection (2), unless the Director has otherwise directed, the lift or escalator concerned may, without a resumption permit, resume its normal use and operation before the Director notifies the person who delivered the certificate to the Director of the Director’s decision as to whether to issue a permit under section 28 or 58 for the lift or escalator.

In relation to subsection (3), unless the Director has otherwise directed, the lift or escalator concerned may, without a use permit, continue to be used and operated before the Director notifies the person who delivered the certificate to the Director of the Director’s decision as to whether to issue a permit under section 26 or 56 for the lift or escalator.

part.name: P6
part.heading:
Pending Applications under Section 6 or 11C of
Repealed Ordinance

section.name: s8
section.heading: Applications under section 6 or 11C of repealed Ordinance

subsection.content: If, immediately before the relevant date, there was a pending application under section 6 of the repealed Ordinance, the application is to be regarded as an application under section 78 or 90 (as the case requires).

If, immediately before the relevant date, there was a pending application under section 11C of the repealed Ordinance, the application is to be regarded as an application under section 74 or 86 (as the case requires).

part.name: P7
part.heading:
Orders of Directors Made under Repealed
Ordinance etc.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Orders of Director made under repealed Ordinance
section.content: An order of the Director made under the repealed Ordinance that is in force immediately before the relevant date and would have continued to be in force on that date, but for the coming into operation of section 157, continues to be in force and, subject to sections 10 and 11 of this Schedule, the Director may enforce the order under that Ordinance as if that Ordinance had not been repealed by section 157.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Supplementary provisions in relation to orders made under section 27(1) of repealed Ordinance

subsection.content: Section 27(2) of the repealed Ordinance does not apply in relation to an order made on any of the grounds mentioned in section 27(1) (other than section 27(1)(e)) of that Ordinance, and the order continues to be in force until the Director is satisfied that the lift or escalator is in safe working order and has revoked the order.

Section 27(3) of the repealed Ordinance does not apply in relation to an order made on the ground mentioned in section 27(1)(e) of that Ordinance, and the order continues to be in force until the Director is satisfied that the lift or escalator is in safe working order and has revoked the order.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Offences regarding contravention of order made under section 27(1) of repealed Ordinance

subsection.content: Section 29(3), (4) and (5) of the repealed Ordinance does not apply in relation to the use or operation of a lift or escalator that is the subject of an order made under section 27(1) of that Ordinance.

If a person uses or operates a lift or escalator in contravention of an order mentioned in subsection (1), the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

If a person causes or permits any other person to use or operate a lift or escalator in contravention of an order mentioned in subsection (1), the person commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 12 months.

It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (2) to prove that the person did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the use or operation was prohibited under an order mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: It is a defence for a person charged under subsection (3) to prove that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: did not know and could not with due diligence have discovered that the use or operation was prohibited under an order mentioned in subsection (1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contravention occurred without the person’s consent or connivance and that the person had taken all reasonable steps to prevent the use or operation of the lift or escalator.

subsection.content: Subsections (2) and (3) do not apply to the use or operation of a lift or escalator in emergency circumstances affecting the safety of any person or property.

Subsections (2) and (3) do not apply if the use or operation of the lift or escalator is for the purposes of performing any function conferred or imposed on a person by or under this Ordinance, including complying with or giving effect to an order of the Director under this Ordinance.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Disconnection of supply of electricity under repealed Ordinance

subsection.content: If the supply of electricity to a lift has been disconnected under section 38 of the repealed Ordinance, reconnection of the supply of electricity is prohibited unless written permission has been obtained from the Director.

If the supply of electricity to an escalator has been disconnected under section 38 of the repealed Ordinance, reconnection of the supply of electricity is prohibited unless written permission has been obtained from the Director.
If there is a contravention of subsection (1), section 31(3) and (4) applies in relation to the contravention as if the disconnection of the supply of electricity had been effected under section 31.
If there is a contravention of subsection (2), section 61(3) and (4) applies in relation to the contravention as if the disconnection of the supply of electricity had been effected under section 61.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Disciplinary proceedings under repealed Ordinance

subsection.content: If, immediately before the relevant date, there were proceedings pending in a disciplinary board appointed under section 8 or 11E of the repealed Ordinance, the proceedings may be continued under the repealed Ordinance as if that Ordinance had not been repealed by section 157.

In relation to any proceedings mentioned in subsection (1), a member of the disciplinary board appointed to conduct the proceedings continues to perform the functions as such a member until the completion of the proceedings.

Any matter that the Director may refer to the Secretary under section 9 or 11G of the repealed Ordinance before the relevant date may be referred to the Secretary on or after that date and the repealed Ordinance continues to apply in relation to the matter on or after that date as if that Ordinance had not been repealed by section 157.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1) and (3), the power of the disciplinary board under section 9(2)(a)(i) or 11G(2)(a) of the repealed Ordinance is to be construed as a power of the board to order the Registrar to cancel or suspend the registration of the person, as appropriate, under one or more of the following provisions of this Ordinance and the powers of the Court of First Instance under sections 11 and 11I of the repealed Ordinance are to be construed accordingly—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 74(1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: section 78(1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: section 86(1);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: section 90(1).

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with an order under subsection (4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court of First Instance decides to reverse or vary the order, take appropriate actions (if required) to give effect to the decision.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Appeals under repealed Ordinance

subsection.content: If, immediately before the relevant date, there were proceedings pending in an appeal board under the repealed Ordinance, the proceedings may be continued under the repealed Ordinance as if that Ordinance had not been repealed by section 157.

In relation to any proceedings mentioned in subsection (1) a member of the appeal board appointed to conduct the proceedings continues to perform the functions as such a member until the completion of the proceedings.

Despite the coming into operation of section 157, section 18 of the repealed Ordinance continues to apply in relation to a decision of the appeal board mentioned in subsection (1) as if that Ordinance had not been repealed.

A right of appeal under section 6(5), 11C(4) or 15 of the repealed Ordinance that was subsisting immediately before the relevant date may be exercised under the repealed Ordinance on or after that date and that Ordinance continues to apply on or after that date as if it had not been repealed by section 157.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (1) and (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an appeal under section 6(5) or 11C(4) of the repealed Ordinance, the power of the appeal board under section 17(4)(b) of that Ordinance is to be construed as a power of the board to order the Registrar to register the person, as appropriate, under one or more of the following provisions of this Ordinance and the powers of the Court of First Instance under section 18 of the repealed Ordinance are to be construed accordingly—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: section 74(1);

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: section 78(1);

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: section 86(1);

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: section 90(1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to an appeal under section 15 of the repealed Ordinance—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the power of the appeal board under section 17(1) of that Ordinance is to be construed as a power of the board to order the Director to issue a use permit or resumption permit under this Ordinance in respect of the lift or escalator, as appropriate; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the power of the board to make a direction under section 17(2) of the repealed Ordinance is to be construed as a power of the board to order the Director to issue a use permit or resumption permit under this Ordinance in respect of the lift or escalator, as appropriate, if the Director is satisfied that the work specified by the board under that section has been carried out.

subsection.leadIn: The Registrar must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: comply with an order under subsection (5)(a); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Court of First Instance decides to reverse or vary an order of an appeal board appointed under the repealed Ordinance, take appropriate actions (if required) to give effect to the decision.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Display of use permits under section 39 or 69

subsection.content: Section 39 does not apply, before the specified date, to a lift other than a lift to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, if a prescribed examination has been carried out in respect of the lift.

Section 69 does not apply, before the specified date, to an escalator other than an escalator to which section 39(3) of the repealed Ordinance would have applied but for the coming into operation of section 157, if a prescribed examination has been carried out in respect of the escalator.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: LastPrescribedExamination
def.leadIn: last prescribed examination (上次訂明檢驗) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift, the prescribed examination of the lift that was last carried out before the relevant date; and

paragraph.name: b
a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift, examination of the lift, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the lift and testing of the safety equipment provided for the lift, in respect of which a prescribed certificate as defined by section 6(3)(a)(ii) of this Schedule has been issued; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an escalator, examination of the escalator, including examination of all machinery and equipment connected with the escalator and testing of the safety equipment provided for the escalator, in respect of which a prescribed certificate as defined by section 6(3)(b)(ii) of this Schedule has been issued;

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a lift, the 1st anniversary of the date on which the last prescribed examination was carried out in respect of the lift; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to an escalator, the last day of the 6-month period beginning on the date immediately after the date on which the last prescribed examination was carried out in respect of the escalator.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Exemptions granted under section 44A of repealed Ordinance to be regarded as exemptions granted under this Ordinance
section.content: An exemption granted under section 44A of the repealed Ordinance in respect of a lift, which exemption but for the coming into operation of section 157 would have continued to be in force on or after the relevant date, is to be regarded as an exemption from the application of the whole of this Ordinance granted in respect of the lift under section 148 on the relevant date.

part.name: P9
part.heading:
Amendments to Lifts and Escalators Ordinance
(Cap. 618)

section.name: s24
section.heading: Schedule 9 amended (Registration of Lift Engineers and Escalator Engineers)

subsection.leadIn: The requirements mentioned in section 78(2)(a) are that the applicant is a registered professional engineer in any of the following disciplines—

paragraph.content: building services engineering;
control, automation and instrumentation engineering;
electrical engineering;
electronic engineering;
marine and naval architecture engineering;
mechanical engineering,

subsection.continued: and the applicant satisfies the Registrar that the applicant has at least 2 years’ relevant working experience and has the necessary practical experience.”.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements mentioned in section 90(2)(a) are that the applicant is a registered professional engineer in any of the following disciplines—

paragraph.content: building services engineering;
control, automation and instrumentation engineering;
electrical engineering;
electronic engineering;
marine and naval architecture engineering;
mechanical engineering,

subsection.continued: and the applicant satisfies the Registrar that the applicant has at least 2 years’ relevant working experience and has the necessary practical experience.”.
